description:
My cousins and I put ourselves down on the waiting list at Halu (said it was going to be about 30 minutes), so we walked to the nearest bar.

There's billiards here.

It's convenient.

^ unfinished review that was suppose to be uploaded in March. 

All you need to know it's not a bar.

And it was the first time I had tito's chilled.
author: Lilian L.

description:
Went here on Sunday doing a scavenger hunt. 

It became our HQ and we got a lot done here thanks to the patrons and BEN the bartender!

Had an amazing time, good people good beers and shots and beers and shots!

Till next time 540!
author: Tina T.

description:
A friend of mine and I were doing an impromptu Inner Richmond bar crawl. 540 Club ended up being our second stop. We walked in on Friday, May 26th around 5:30pm.

They have happy hour 4pm-7pm, but I'm wasn't sure what qualified as a HH special. I ended up getting a Jameson on the rocks and my friend, a gin and tonic. I believe both drinks were under $10? I didn't get this round, so I'm not really sure, but I think that's what he said.

We started off playing a few rounds of darts up front. I suck at darts, but it was fun just playing a game, drinking, and catching up. We moved on to pool afterwards in the back. Games are $1 each and you can get quarters from the bartender as it is coin operated. We got a second round of drinks and while playing our first game, another friend joined us. I suck at pool as well, so I let him take over the game. The boys played two more games while I finished my drink. And maybe had a third round? I can't really recall if my friend bought a third round of drinks after he showed up.

540 is a little divey, but it's a fun bar. I had a good time playing games and drinking. I haven't been here in forever, so it was nice revisiting an old bar. They have TVs as well, so it'd be great to throw back some drinks while catching a game. A fun stop while hanging out in Inner Richmond.
author: Elena N.

description: This is the best "dive bar" in the Richmond district. The staff is amazing, the crowd is local and the selection of beers is surprisingly awesome! These guys frequently rotate their IPA tap, and feature beers from local companies such as Faction and Revision, two breweries that are extremely relevant in the current west-coast brewing landscape. The gals behind the bar are the best! Michelle and Sally are such amazing people and bartenders, I always enjoy visiting with them. Stop by on the weekend and you might catch a set from the neighborhood DJ Booker D, or grab a taco from the Alfaro truck outside. I have grown to love this spot, and always look forward to my next visit. Thanks for being such a gem on Clement street!
author: Alex E.

description:
540 Club was Stop #2 on a pub crawl that my friends and I did after brunch one Sunday. The bartenders were friendly. I like that there's a small outdoor patio, and it seems dog friendly. I should bring my dog here next time! This place truly has a pub atmosphere, with it's tattered furniture and dingy feel. My friends and I easily found a spot along the wall to chill and order some drinks. 

In the spirit of brunch, I ordered a Bloody Mary. It was alright. Not at the spice level I like, so I'd want to request more fire next time. Then again, I can't argue with the fact that it's a relatively inexpensive bar. Overall it's not my favorite bar, but I could immediately see that it's a go-to for many locals. Pretty standard divey venue, so definitely include this on your next pub crawl!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Cozy bar on Clement with a wide bench and a good choice of drinks + some specials. They do happy hour though I was there late at night.
The bartender​ was friendly. They have a pool table and darts. Simple but nice.
author: Matthew C.

description: This place is a standard dive with pretty cheap drinks. The bartenders are friendly, and dogs are welcome, which makes for a nice ambiance. The only real downside is that it's cash only, so you'll want to make sure you have that ready. They don't do fancy cocktails, but there's plenty of bar seating and tables to hang out and talk to your friends. It's got that real old-timey feel with the worn-down, rustic furniture.
author: Danny C.

description: One of the rudest and ignorant bouncers work the door here. He wouldn't let me into the bar with my REAL 24 year old ID but let my friend who is 19 with a fake ID. His reasoning for not letting me in is because I didn't remember my horoscope sign so assumed the ID was not mine. I offered to show him my debit cards matching my ID and he refused and said I could not come in. Never coming here again due to this bouncer, stay away!
author: Audrey N.

description:
My kind of place.

-People
-Dogs
-Beer
-Pool table
-Chalkboard
-Posted reminders to not be a jerk
-People who look like they're escaping their roommates
-Screen playing old movies with actors whose names you SWEAR you remember but can't
-Serviceable bathrooms
-Friendly folks

There was a DJ hella feeling himself and his jams, so much so that I'm sure no one was missing the internet jukebox. I surely didn't.
author: Loli L.

description: Love this place. A local, divey bar that also makes fantastic cocktails and has great bartenders (shoutout to Amanda, she was awesome)? I'm there. You can tell a lot of the people who come here are regulars and I don't blame them. Prices are amazing, they have a great liquor selection, they make really tasty cocktails, and they even had a good beer list. Plus they have a bunch of events and while they don't serve food, there was a food truck outside when I went there. Can't ask for much more from a chill neighborhood bar. Well I guess it would be nice if they took credit cards. But there are both a Bank of American and a Wells Fargo within walking distance (and probably other stuff nearby too) so the cash only things isn't terrible. 5 stars.
author: Seema U.

description:
Time flies at the 540 Club. I came in with my friend Jon P. at around 3:30 on a Monday afternoon, planning to hang out before a reading at Green Apple at 7. Those three and a half hours slipped right by, with more friends joining us as the day went on. I probably overdid it a bit, but I had lots of fun.

The place was mostly empty the whole time we were there. I really liked the space. It was comfortable with a nice, low-key atmosphere, a truly lovely neighborhood bar. Jon and I sidled up to the bar and got drinking quickly. The bartender was awesome, very helpful and friendly, giving us tastes of this or that beer when we expressed interest. I don't remember exactly what I drank, to be honest, but I definitely had a couple beers on tap for something like $4 apiece during happy hour (or maybe just Monday hour?). At some point I tried some of the Death & Taxes, a great beer I'd never had before.

The only hiccup was that 540 Club is cash only, and the ATM was not having it with my card. Luckily, I found a Wells Fargo ATM around the corner, and evaded both the machine troubles and the corresponding withdrawal fees. The faulty machine worked to my advantage in the end, I guess, but probably not a great feature overall.

In any case, I had a great time at 540 Club and would definitely come again on any future visits to the Inner Richmond. It was a neat spot with delicious beer at affordable prices, a winning place to while away the hours.
author: Steph C.

description:
Ho Ho! Someone can't understand why a bar that caters to locals won't let douchbags in santa suits come in and fuck up the place.

I can't understand why sane person would dress up in a santa claus costume and expect to be treated like a customer deserving of service. Are you kidding me? Santacon shitheads are renowned for showing up wasted, not paying and not tipping. Try and chase one down for walking out on on their tab and they all look alike. That's the scam! Did you read the report about the guy in the Santa suit that robbed a bank on 'Santacon' day? Yeah, you guessed it, they couldn't find his cause there were 60 other shitheads drunk on the street in santa suits.

This place rocks, and if you can't figure that out in your street clothes, go to The Richmond Republic. 

4 stars, check it out
author: Statin Island V.

description:
This place is a bit divey but we happen to love that. Good location to grab a drink while waiting two hours for your table at Burma Superstar, down the street. There was a food truck outside and people were chewing down on chips and other good smelling Mexican food so I assume that this place will let you bring your own food in.

The bar tender was rolling solo and handled a full bar easily. As we left, around 9 reinforcements arrived for what I assume to be a busier late night crowd.

I'd come back if I had to wait for a table at a nearby restaurant again but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here since I live on the other side of the city but probably would if I was in the neighborhood. Who doesn't love decent service and reasonably priced drinks!
author: Sarah S.

description:
I wish I could have liked this place or even tried this place, but I have never been so disrespected in my life from their staff. I was completely shocked by how they were treating people (not just my group).

My friends and I came up to the city for Santacon and we walked by this empty bar, so we thought it would be a good idea to grab a drink here to get us started. I was finishing up a cigarette so some of my friends went in first. I hurried to finish my cigarette, but as I was entering my friends informed my that they weren't allowed service because they don't serve people going to Santacon.

This didn't make any sense to me. So I went inside to ask what the problem was. Before I could even say anything, they told me that I was not dressed properly for this bar. I was dressed in dark jeans and a red shirt. I understand denying service from my friend because he was dressed as Santa, but I was just wearing regular clothes.This place is 1 dollar sign, so they are lucky I didn't show up in sweat pants.

Not wasting my time on this dump. No thanks.
author: Theo T.

description:
Back in my college days this was a pretty cool spot, but either my tastes have changed or this place has.  Bummed by the limited options of beer on tap. 
Plus for letting dogs in the bar. I luv that.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
I only stopped in here at 2:30pm on a sunday because I had some spicy pepper stuck in the wrong tube, and needed something to wash it down. It was either a 2 dollar PMT or 2 dollar PBR. 

Since PBR is like water, I opted for that. We walked into this bar and there were a few people watching NFL (seattle vs washington). 

The bartender was friendly and greeted us, asked to see my ID, and got my $2 PBR very promptly. I saw that they had a good selection of beer on tap including Deschutes. 

My experience here was very short, (about 5 minutes), so I can't comment too much.

Pros: 
- $2 PBR (+$1 Tip) = $3 out of pocket.
- This place has some character and I personally feel that it might be a dive bar and doesn't seem to fit in with the rest of the area.

Cons:
- None yet

I'll definitely be back to check it out and add another review at that time!
author: Kaje Y.

description: I went here on Monday Sept 19, 2016 11:00pm'sh.  Reason for coming here is for the karaoke, thrown by Jess.  I ordered two glasses of cranberry juice at $2 each and the female bartender was attentive (I'm glad she didn't ask me if I wanted vodka with it, although I really wanted to drink alcohol but due to my condition).  There were a few friends  I recognized at this bar.  When I sang my song, I think they need to adjust their speakers, I had to project into the microphone. Jess needs to find out which controls the particular speakers, etc. Decent dive bar with fair amount of persons, couple of pool tables in the back, with 5 or more tvs.
author: Jer W.

description:
This bar is one of the reasons I love my neighborhood. It's just good, raw fun. Not overcrowded. One of the only dive bars I will continue patronizing alone, with friends, on dates...

The bartenders are solid. They don't take sh** from anyone. Tim is awesome. I mean, who doesn't like Tim? Crazy talk. Ben makes the best Bloody Mary's. Clark is loveliness in a shot glass.
author: Bharu J.

description:
I went here last night with a few friends (3)  and am not feeling inclined to ever come back. My friends and I went here to play some pool grab a couple drinks. We had been out for a couple hours and wanted to whine down somewhere. 

Anyways one of us ordered a couple drinks and we waited our turn to play pool. We finish the first game and one of the men that was playing before came up to give us tips on how to play. I asked him if he and his friend wanted to play again and he insisted several times that we should play again. Mind you there's MAYBE 20 people in this bar, not at all crowded. Not even all of the sits at the bar were taken. 

We start our 2nd game and the bartender --white bald headed male-- walks up so us and says "The pool table is for paying customers only and only one of you has been buying drinks. I have a line of people waiting here wanting to play!" 

WHOA! How RUDE! There has been plenty of times have have been to this bar and have bought 4-5 drinks but this was a good way to insure that I don't ever come back or recommend this place to friends. ---which is ironic to say because the my gf and i brought the couple that was with us there because we believed it to be a great place to chill. 

There was no line waiting to play...they even had a chalk broad for people to write their name on if they wanted to play after (that's what we did) and it was blank. I understand if you want people to spend money at your establishment but there's a right and a really f*cking rude way of approaching people. 

We will never be back. 

Ps. We left that bar and when to a classic neighborhood bar 'The Bitter End' and order 4 drinks there. 

Being a jerk does not pay off in the end.
author: Raquel H.

description:
Can't think of anything I'd change about this place except maybe upgrade the bathrooms but what dive in thr City doesn't need that?

Friendly bartrnders, local chill crowd, and the Giants are always on.

Nice little outdoor seating area at the entrance; kinda cramped pool table in the back of the bar; drink specials during games are listed on the chalkboard on the sidewalk. 

Come in and have a drink.
author: Yelper F.

description:
Lately, I've been in a crabby mood, but since it's that special time of year, I need to be in the HO HO HO spirit! I hereby yelp 540 Club. 

When I lived in this inner Richmond 'hood', I hit this place up a handful of times, and have always been good ones at that. I love that the 540 Club is so unassuming, amidst the mini Chinatown that is Clement Street. Like others have mentioned before, it's not quite a club, but mainly a super chill, no frills bar. There are a few tables and chairs for your smoking and drinking pleasure out in front. 
Inside, it's pretty dark and with SF Giants paraphernalia throughout. Fully stocked with beers on tap and your choice of spirits. Music isn't bad, either! Apparently, there's a new pool table towards the back of the bar. 

Clientele are mainly local folk. Last time I was there, I was having a catch-up convo with a friend, and some completely clueless fella tried to interrupt us while his buddy was using the bathroom. Sorry dude, while you were friendly, you talked too much and were trying way too hard to impress us. 

AnywHOoters, the best part of about the 540 is that they have HOs on tap. That's right, my beloved Hoegaarden is on draft, my dear Yelp friends. Oh Mylanta indeed! What's there not to love about dem HOs? 

Must get to the Inner Richmond more often. Who wants to join me? I hear they have a wicked Happy HOur! 

Cheers and HO HO HO!
author: Gill C.

description:
3.5 stars,

The 540 is like a friend that has multi personalities: Sometimes it is the most rocking bar.....and than sometimes it is the douchiest place on earth.

Yes it is funky divey. Yes it has a very eclectic clientele, Yes they have some very interesting drinks...what was that alcoholic cider I had...brrrrrrhhhhhaaaa.

But most strikingly it is who is drinking with you at the bar....and who is serving.

Some patrons are really nice people other are just not happy campers and want to take you with them on their misery vacation.

The old skool projector tv in the back really sucks though....come on guys buy a flat screen...I will make it up in more shots!
author: David G.

description:
If you're a semi-alcoholic like me, then this is definitely the place for you. All the bartenders are friendly and very laid back. Patrons can bring in their puppies and outside food.... Enjoy the provided entertainment: Various shows on the TV's, loud & laughing bartenders..... oooooor my group of boys at the back pool table dodging my stick & balls of fury. 

The drinks are well made and everyone knows each other. Keep in mind that this isn't a library, so be prepared to have all your senses entertained.
author: Hungry Dan o.

description:
The punk rock nexus of the Inner Richmond.  This bar features monthly dj nights from SFCR/KUSF-in-exile djs, who bring a wealth of great music with them.

Aside from that, this is one of the few places you're likely to find west of Divisadero that has that lower Haight/Mission dive bar atmosphere. 

Not too crowded for comfort, and not so empty as to be uninviting.  This place is worth stopping by for a few drinks with your friends on the weekend.

You could bring your hipster friends or your middle-aged square friends, and neither will feel out of place here.

They started carrying Alpine Beer Company beers here, like Nelson and Hoppy Birthday.  Those are two of my favorite beers, and very hard to find in SF.  That makes this place a beer destination to be considered on any night out.
author: Gopal R.

description:
I wish I lived closer to this place so I don't have to walk thru the park at creep-o-clock in the morning. I've stopped by during the day for a quick drink, and more recently at night for a few hours. The bartenders are SO nice! And I know it was just the gal's pandora stations but she had impeccable taste. 

We went on a Monday, so it was $3 well drinks and certain beers.. $2 PBRs always apparently. And there was actually a good number of people in here for the start of the workweek.
author: Vivian H.

description: A simple pub with a nice staff and a great atmosphere. It has TVs to watch sport, great and affordable beers and even some table outside to enjoy a drink with some fresh air. I spent some great evening here and will do it again for sure
author: Benoit L.

description: One of my favorite bars. Amazing bartenders, awesome music (chosen by those amazing bartenders). Divey in a great way. Superb beer selections. Only detractor, internet jukebox.
author: Erikake Z.

description: Stumbled upon this place while walking down Clement after dinner. Good old school, r&b/hiphop music and a variety of drinks. There's a pool table and dart board to keep you entertained and also an outside patio. Dog-friendly!
author: Theresa N.

description:
I kept wanting to go here, then going when I was already inebriated and thinking "Man, this place rules. I'll have to come back when I am cognizant of being here." So, for awhile, I thought the 540 Club was a snazzy joint because I was already having a good time. 

If you're already having a good time, the 540 Club is the place for you. 

If you're starting out your night here, it can be a little bland. There's a pool table and occasionally a dog (++for being cute), but it's pretty small and the clientele can get loud and annoying. They can also get up from the bar and make out in front of your table for a long time and prevent you from leaving. At least they're passionate.

There's nothing too remarkable about their beer selection. And their bathrooms are atrocious. Have you ever thought "Am I peeing in a storage space?" If you would like to, please go here.

Like I said, this place is 5 stars if you've already had 5+ drinks. I kind of wish I didn't ruin the illusion.

CASH ONLY, Y'ALL.
author: Sam D.

description:
I've worked near here for over a year now, but I've never been here before. Last month I decided to go in one Sunday morning for a bloody mary since I saw a few reviews saying that they were made tasty here. And oh yes...they are. Good and spicy. 

Since I'm a beer freak the other thing that I noticed was that they have an awesome constantly-rotating selection of beer. The first time I was there they had Blacke Butte XXIII on tap. Last time I was there the Anchor Zymaster Lager and Heretic Evil Cousin were readily available. 

The place is pretty large and everyone (patrons and bartenders) are pretty dang friendly.
author: Kyle K.

description: Nice little dive bar. Descent service nothing spectacular. Good prices. Pool table, juke box, and I think there were also darts. Visiting family in San Francisco and it was within walking distance, so we tried it. Played some pool and had some drinks, we'd consider visiting it again in the future.
author: Miranda S.

description: My former local watering hole, the 540 does have its usual local crowd. The owner jaime is a laid back fellow. (Not a bad pool player either) and of course it's homes to the dregs of the inner Richmond district. The other was my first choice dirty trix. Maybin rest in peace. The 540 club is like hotel california. It's def hard to leave it especially if all you friends go there. Great for day drinking on Sundays during football season or pretty much during the week. It may not look good but it provides all the fun and action of a true dive bar. Whenever I come into the city I always have to stop in for a beer or three.
author: Jrod Y.

description:
In case you've ever wondered what your typical bar in SF looks like, well, here we have a prime example.

You enter, and there's the bar, up against the wall to your right, and it spans the length to the back. As with most SF buildings, built to an Edwardian or Victorian style, it tunnels back, far into the depths, devoid of windows or other breaks. In the rear, you'll find the bathroom, which is quite satisfactory for a bar bathroom. The decor is stylish, worn, clean but used, a mixture of sports banners and luscious curtains.

They'll treat you well enough, but will treat the regulars and locals better. You'd do well to play nice with others and stay out of sight lines during games. If you wield loud conversation instead of douche baggery, you'll leave with new friends in your midst, and a blithe demeanor.

Stay away if you can't stand cigarette smoke drifting in from the entrance, want to drop it like it's hot and pop your collar, or tend to swing Louboutin heels after you've had a couple cosmos. 

Oh, and it's a Giants bar. An awesome Giants bar.
author: Darrell L.

description: I like to spend money here.  The 1-star review below about Santacon dudes getting denied makes me like to spend money here even more.
author: Floyd B.

description:
A great little place to get beer.  They have a bunch of different ones on tap at a reasonable price.  Lots of places to sit too.

There was some kind of game table in the back but I don't remember what it was...
author: Wally W.

description:
$2 pbr but...CASH ONLY

I like how the place is very chill. Came here to watch the niners game and there's 3 big flat screens. I like how it wasn't too crowded and no douche/rowdy sports fan. The bartenders are pretty down to earth. Just wish they accepted credit cards so I could drink more. They have an atm but I'm not a fan of using atm's.
author: Victoria C.

description: Best pool table in a bar I have seen in a long time. Friendly barkeeps, and pbr on tap. The 540 club is winning.
author: Nathan B.

description: One of my favorite spots to congregate with the locals. Great place to sit inside or outside and not a busy street later in the night. Beers and cocktails are on point and not expensive. Pool table and bathroom in the back.
author: Chase S.

description:
Beers are a bit more expensive than usual places ($6) but relatively chill place. Not too crowded and the bartenders are all pretty calm. They have a pool table which is nice and definitely better than just sitting around drinking for hours.

They have two bathrooms, a unisex one behind the pool tables and a women's down the hallway at the end of the bar.

Would I make the trip out here just for this? Probably not. But not a bad place to be if I was nearby.
author: Jessica H.

description: Damn this place can be cheap. Attracts the college crowd and can be a tad skeezy, but the bartender who served us was friendly and I enjoyed the Tiki Tuesday drinks.
author: Katie S.

description:
I was a regular here for a while - probably too long if I'm honest.

Friendly bartenders you can get to know if you're so inclined. A good cast of regular characters - they run the gamut from young professionals to retirees.

Best spot in the neighborhood to watch a Giants game - more energy here than in AT&T park.

Good beer selection and happy hour. Occasionally they'll have food for a special event.

It's a dive bar - keep your cleanliness expectations in line.

This is a great local bar with a nice focus on the community.
author: Bill R.

description:
I'm definitely coming back here again.

A local spot.

Cheap drinks

Good music (the DJ was playing mixed of 80's rock and top 40)

The bartenders are cool. They were dancing around the bar to get the crowd engaged. 

Mellow and chill atmosphere.

Clean bathrooms.

Plus, its close to home and plenty of parking. :)
author: Carol Y.

description:
I can't believe I've lived in this 'hood for 9 years and am just now getting around to checking out this place.  A little beaten up in appearance, but doesn't that make for a great neighborhood bar?  Friendly bartender, quick service, CHEAP prices for great beers on tap.  We were there on a slow night but the noise level was perfect - easy to talk with friends, but just enough music in the background. (Sidenote: music selection = hilarious.  Siouxsie, Madonna covers, wow). 

Definitely will be back soon to check out happy hour and Monday/Tuesday night specials!
author: Heidi M.

description: Charming little dive bar on clement. Nothin fancy.  Solid beer selection including $2 pints of PBR. Excellent spot for a quick drink anytime of day. I just happen to drop in to check Giants score on an unusually warm Saturday in October.  So many good dim sum spots in the area requires a pilsner or ale and I'm you can bring your goodies and eat outside in the small patio out front. I will be back!
author: Ron P.

description:
Maybe this is a dive I thought. Maybe this is a place to fall asleep in the back.
I liked it, I liked the 540 Club, i liked drinking here because it wasn't a dive and I didn't want to sleep in back. The bartenders were rad and the crowd was pretty cool. I saw people hook up and I saw people stagger, that's what a bar is all about, y'all!
author: Alexander R.

description: I've stopped by this place a couple of times, Mondays, for pool league. A couple of Mondays ago, the SF/dodgers series was in SF and they just happened to show Zito's excellent game in its entirety on TV. Usually they just have music playing in the background. I don't remember whether it was $1 or $2 PBRs, but it certainly was past happy hour time and I thought that was a great deal. Bartender seems friendly. The pool table plays a little faster than most bar pool tables, but I can deal with it as that's how tables in a pool hall usually play.
author: Gerard Y.

description: So relieved to read Kyla's review. I have seen similar agression at this bar. I like the atmosphere but not impressed by the clientele.
author: Vanessa T.

description:
A bar that allows dogs inside the place.. What else is there to say? 

Good if you like dogs and bad for those who don't. But also a health code violation..
author: M C.

description:
I'm definitely a fan!  I dropped into 540 Club with my lady-friend and dog after reading that the bar was dog-friendly.  It definitely delivers on the dog-friendliness;  our pup enjoyed tons of pets, a bowl of water, and the endless playtime provided by the light reflecting off the disco ball on the dance floor.

The human experience was also enjoyable.  The tap's great, the bar has plenty of seating, and the rock-art decor is cool.  The patrons even demonstrated responsible control over the jukebox.  Love it.

I'd like to come back here during peak hours to see what the experience is like, but I'm definitely a fan of the lazy hours.
author: Bill H.

description:
Yes, you CAN hate $1 drinks. Especially if you're older than 19 and not an alcoholic. This place has terrible cocktails--primarily because their bartenders are more interested in getting you drunk cheaply than in mixing a great drink. If you ask for anything above a well drink, expect the person on staff to try to talk you down to something crappier. I don't think they even stock very many upper tier liquors. Bottom line: If you like good drinks and quality liquor, then go somewhere else. 

On another note: While it's kind of charming in a crappy/dive-y way, the regulars are way skeezy.
author: Catherine T.

description:
540 Club: This bar in the inner Richmond district at 7th & Clement. Here you can sit outside in a tattered and torn black banquet chair and enjoy one of the best Bloody Mary's, made from scratch, on the non-descript patio, I have noticed that the price ranges from $5.00 to $7.00 for said Bloody Mary, depending on the bartender; but I have also noticed that they are always worth every penny.

This bar is all about the drinks; 12 beers on draft, $1.00 beers, $2.00 cocktails, no food, lots of smoking and cranky bartenders.  The last according to the San Francisco Bay Guardian Best Bartender Award, which says, "All for one and one for all, the entire staff of the 540 Club is awarded the Crankiest Bartender Award! Tread lightly when approaching these easily irritated and always annoyed bartenders. They may be smiling, attentive and giving you great service and sincerely happy-but don't let that fool you!" As for me, I dig this place. Grab a Bloody Mary, sit on the patio and watch drivers navigate the narrow streets, smell fish markets preparing for business and thank God I live in San Francisco. For more information, photos and fun, visit my blog at: http://thenoisebeneaththeapple.com/
author: Heather J.

description:
I've been trying to piece together how to explain why some bars are superior to other bars. Do we like certain bars more for their proximity to our homes? Do we like places with discounted well drinks or extensive beers on tap? Do we value good live music or unique jukebox selections or attractive clientele or the fact that the bartenders will still serve you after you've thrown up all over the urinal? 

Is it enough to say that some bars rock your socks because they just rock the socks like no other sock-rockers? Maybe not. Maybe I've forfeited all my Useful votes on this one.

But it doesn't matter. The 540 Club rocks my damn socks. It just does. It rocks because no bar in the Inner Clement rocks quite like the 540 Club. I just got all tautological on your ass. You're welcome.

OK, fine. The best single instance of the 540's awesome sauce arose last night. Packed bar, DJ serving up all those sweet tunes from the 80's and beyond, bartenders pouring serious well drinks for all the somber alcoholics in the house. The DJ switches to the unmistakable wah-wah opening strains of Jon Bon Jovi's "Living on a Prayer," as if that song could belong to anyone else. The chorus kicks in. Sweaty glasses and arms raise into the air. Voices belt out in unison. 

"Ooooooooohhhhhhh, we're halfway they-yere!" 

Not Obama in Grant Park inspiring, but close. Did I mention how this bar rocks my socks?
author: Kimberly V.

description: Great dive with very choice taps. Last time they had a Belgian triple which knocked me on my ass. Reasonable prices especially during happy hour. If you don't drink beer they have an impressive liquor collection (Glenfiddich 30 and the full array of Hangar One vodkas) too but as always be prepared to pay dearly for calls like that.
author: Josh K.

description:
Having a night of dollar drinks at 540 Club is a beautiful, disturbing mess. It's exciting in the way that going to Costco is exciting. You think, drink, feel, and act in bulk. For five bucks, it's easy to get good and sloppy.

Here's my sick rationalization: since dollar drinks are only from ten to midnight, you'll want to stock up. You'll hoard a pile of drinks like they're cash, like you're storing booze for a long winter. You'll still be flattered when a stranger offers to buy you a drink, even if it's in fucking quarters.

That's how Monday nights are at 540 Club. But it's okay.

This sounds fun, economical even, but it's bad news too. Chances are, you'll talk to people you wouldn't even share the bathroom line with. You'll get numbers you'll never use and friend requests that won't even ring a dim, distant bell in your mind come Tuesday afternoon.

It's the super cheap drinks, just working their will.
author: Jiordan C.

description: I think I may have found an underlying reason to some of the terrible reviews I have seen written about this place. After being kicked out because my friend did not tip the bartender who rudely greeted him, I was told by the bouncer that both he and the bartender are "fully tatted skin heads". Makes a lot more sense why they were both wearing hats. Anyways if you don't support people who hate others or even more simply those in the service industry who are incredibly rude to customers, then I'd steer clear of this place
author: Gaelan K.

description:
Cool bar.  Challenging trivia.  Friendly patrons ... that are smarter than me.

I looked to all the cool posters on the wall for inspiration of which I found none during the music round of trivia.  I think I'll enjoy it more next time if I were drinking and not so physically and mentally exhausted.

Excuses.
author: Kathleen W.

description:
$1 well drinks after 10 pm on Mondays.

Every person in my group being asked by not even the bartender to come up and verify our IDs individually when one person tries to buy a round (I see that chick often, she's a regular and a friend of them all, but she doesn't even work there! Annoying...). 

540 Club, I'm getting too old for your antics.

Ahhh, but I still love ya. How can I resist all your elephants and dogs? And your twinkly tropical-looking bar? And your eclectic jukebox? And that super-cute bar-back? :)

Although I'm constantly (and sometimes defiantly) trying to prove that YES, I am over 21, DAMMIT, I guess I can see why they'd be strict about their carding policy... it's a total college hangout. But students are just a portion of the diverse crowd here, where it's always fun to people-watch. Heck, I even love 540's dark, dank carpeted hallway to the bathroom. The bathroom where I always forget what's up with the paper towels--can you imagine, a 5'3", often mistaken for 18 but is really 23 year-old, loaded up on 3 dollars-worth of vodka crans, befuddledly clawing at the remnants sticking from an automatic paper towel dispenser at 12 AM on a Monday night? 

Don't let me fool you, I swear I'm too old and wise for all this. 540, can $1 wells start just an hour earlier? I need more buffer time to rest my brittle, inebriated bones for tomorrow.
author: Kate V.

description:
4 words, cause I am drunk and can't possibly type much more........

Dollar drinks on Monday!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Drue C.

description:
Great neighborhood bar, and receptive to outsiders as well. Always a variety of people coming through--hipsters, punks, stoners, mediocres, musicians, middle-agers & even a few yuppies looking to explore somewhere besides the Marina. 

Live DJs through most of the week, music ranging from Sunday soul, punk & even some folk/americana. Internet Jukebox which I'm told by Richie (the hat-wearing bartender) is the most played jukebox in all of San Francisco. Also, free wireless internet if you're looking to have a few drinks & surf the net or get some work done on the patio.

Ken, the doorman, is actually a blues musician. If you catch him on a good night he'll carry on conversation--sometimes he can be a little moody though.

The bar displays different artwork on occasion, most of the time it's pretty marginal--keep in mind you aren't there to appreciate art, you're there to get drunk. If you're looking for Pubquiz, it's on Sunday--the same neighbourhood crowd tends to roll in an compete every week. 

In my opinion, Sunday afternoon is the best time to visit the 540...they have free BBQ for all the patrons. $1 drinks on Monday is cheap, but tends to bring in the USF college cronies.

Overall, a wonderful bar in a great neighbourhood.
author: matt m.

description:
Big fan of the music and art! Great bar if you just want to chill, play some pool, and drink cheap drinks after 10pm (on Mondays)! 

I'll definitely be back!
author: Maria C.

description:
I used to walk past this place grocery shoppin' on clement with the mum since I was a toddler and got the impression this was where the lonely old alcoholics and biker guys drank in the daytime.

Now that I am an alcoholic myself, I visited this place a few times and actually like the vibe at night. At night it's filled with a younger crowd and I've always gotten a relaxed vibe from here. Love that it's near my house and you can stumble down to King of Thai that's open till about the time you pass out (that's 2 am folks).
author: Allen L.

description:
My friends and I frequently lament the "540 vortex" that seems to be responsible for sucking so much of the time, money, and variety out of our lives these days. We're confessed 540 addicts. But in truth, we're not that concerned about it. We're not doing anything to remedy it. We accept it; we OWN it. 

We still go through the motion of asking "where should we go?" for that weeknight drink (that inevitably turns into two, or three, or four...) when we know the answer. The other night, while we were out with a friend, Matt M. had the ludicrous notion to start the "what's your favorite bar in San Francisco?" conversation, as if we didn't know what we REALLY wanted to say, despite our best attempts to seem far more well-trodden than we really are...

We have a problem. And the problem has a great big elephant in the window. And $1 wells on Monday nights. And we love our problem.  We love the bartenders who pour no-nonsense, cheap drinks and flatter the regulars only subtly. We love the surly doorman. We love the grungy little smoking patio where we see the same familiar neighborhood faces again and again, intermixed with new and interesting people that we're somehow not afraid to chat up. We love trading stories about the latest literature on the bathroom walls...

We even watched the Superbowl here, for crying out loud. Nothing can tear us away...
author: Lisa T.

description:
I'm in my same pickle as to the wisdom of rating this place so highly when what I like about it is based on my Friday Night Factor (see my Bender's review) and don't want to show up next time to see 750 idiots requesting cosmos at the bar and stanking up the place.  Alas, the dangers of advertising.  Nonetheless...

I love this bar, from the location, decent staff, goodie beer selection (9% baby), lack of bullcrap scenesters, outdoor area to chill, trivia nights, random times when there's free food just because people are nice, etc.. 

The place has the basic temperament of "Don't be a dick," which I find admirable in a neighborhood where the turnover of restaurants and bars is fairly frequent.  540 has survived because loyal patrons come here to chill and have a drink, and even when it gets rowdy, it's usually not so bad.  I'd advise to come on a weeknight when you can relax.   

It's a dive with a pink elephant heart.
author: betty b.

description:
-1 star for the really mean bouncer, but I guess thats his job?

Get there early on Mondays for $1 well drinks. Drinks were small, but more than worth the price. Nice bartender. Really fun crowd, but my friends were running a few minutes late, and after they arrived round 10:30 they had to wait in line for awhile. I would absolutely go back.
author: Eve D.

description:
Went for advertised Monday well drinks for a dollar. they were three.

after ordering multiple rounds went outside of the bar to smoke marijuana as a medical patient. was immediately kicked out by bartender without explanation - despite showing my medical card. 

born and raised in sf and been going to bars for years. first time that has ever happened. other patrons were confused. 

ruined an otherwise ok experience
author: Brian S.

description: It's a dive bar with peeling upholstery and a dirty bathroom. But they make the best martinis in town (Ketel One for $8 - cheaper than most bars in the city ... And friendly bartender, too!
author: Hans D.

description:
Long narrow bar, dim lights, nice place to chill with your girlfriends on Monday nights. $1 well drinks in dixy cups!

The couches are really torn up though, they should really do something about it. Floor can get really dirty and sticky from all the spilled drinks.
author: Erica L.

description:
Came here on a Monday night for the $1 well drinks. Its a great deal but the bar gets very crowded. The deal last between 10pm-12am. After midnight the drinks go up to $4-$5 which is still pretty good. 

The inside of the bar is basically falling apart. We were trying to sit on the couch but some couch cushions were missing. They definitely need to touch up this place. The music was absolutely awful and after a while became unbearable! It was actually one of the reasons we chose to leave. However, I did enjoy the poster art on the walls that they had for sale. 

I guess this is an alright dive bar if your looking for really cheap drinks.
author: Kate G.

description:
Per my friend, Timmy Lincecum himself was at Dollar Drink night this past Monday! Now, he didn't propose to me like I thought he was going to, but i hear it was quite a stir regardless!

Even a pro athlete likes a good deal apparently!


Timmy, come again. I'll be waiting.
author: An-Nhien L.

description: Monday night $1 drinks. What else can I say?
author: Misha T.

description: Cool bar, the bartender had a great attitude. Their deals are awesome. I would go back again.
author: Tony D.

description:
Best bar in The Richmond. Awesome service, great music on weekends, and some nice art exibits. I love all of the bartenders, Miki is a sweetheart. They have free WiFi and a good vibe. 

If you're looking for a relaxed bar in the Inner Richmond with great service and good prices this is the spot.
author: Trev C.

description:
Unfortunately my experience here was unfortunate...

I went into this place with the intentions of loving it- it's a few of my friends second home after all( can you say every Sunday and every other night of the week), and in my hood.
That's why I was so confused at the way I was treated here. Let's just say the bartender was an A*hole obviously having an "I'm a fucking bartender in San  Francisco and therefor am better and smarter than you and pretty much  rule the world" moment.
It took 20 minutes to get served as he blatantly ignored us and then accused us of having fake Id's, after sitting there and bending them in our face for another 3 minutes- for no apparent reason!!

The doorman was super friendly though and told me to talk to the owner about what had just happened. I did, and he was also super friendly and obviously very disappointed and frustrated that HIS bartender had treated me this way. He apologized repeatedly and assured me that is not normal for this place. He said they are a neighborhood bar and like to keep their customers happy. I wanted to believe him, I really did. 

Unfortunately though, him and the doorman were the only redeeming factors and the bartender experience was just so traumatizing I don't think I could go here again. (or even go into it in more detail)

I still feel bad giving one star because owner was so nice and concerned and really cared about my experience and what I had to tell him. So they get 2''. One for him and one for the doorman.
author: Rachel G.

description:
Stopped in on Saturday November 12th, 2011 around 6 PM and was greeted quickly by the bar-keep who got my order of a Bulleit Rye on the Rocks for $9.

Place had numerous tv's on - showing the Oregon vs Stanford Game. Seemed like a nice neighborhood bar. Will be back again.
author: Brian D.

description:
I have this "thing" with Mondays.

I used to just flat out hate Mondays, but somewhere in the last few years, that changed.  I decided to reconfigure the week to make Monday the last day of the "weekend", at least in mind.  It's helped immensely in extending the "weekend" feel and shortening the work week.  It's amazing how quickly Friday comes when you have to only go through Tuesday - Thursday.

So all too often, at about 2-4 PM on Mondays, I start thinking, "Happy Hour Time!"  My friends have transformed into creatures who fear the inevitable text or e-mail from me on Mondays stating location, time, and plans.

Yesterday - the text that went out was, "Happy Hour @ 540 Club. 6:30 tonight. Dinner at Shabu House after."

I received texts back, most starting with, "Seriously - what is it with you and Mondays?" only to confirm that they will be attending.

Well, I had picked 540 Club because a quick search on Yelp showed me that Mondays are $1 drinks at 540.  WRONG!  

MORE ACCURATE: 
Mondays have a regular "happy hour special" from 5-7 pm, and then from 10PM to closing, they have $1 specials on well liquors.

Alright, so my "cool" plans of hosting a $1 Happy Hour went down the drain, but a big group of us (16 planned, 12 showed) gathered to drink our regularly-priced drinks.

Immediately - 540 gained points for having "Death and Taxes" Black Beer.  Delicious stuff.  But Hoegaarden was also on tap - and the "planner" in me decided that this would be a better first choice as I'd taste nothing else after the black beer.  Additional props for having Leffe, in addition to Guinness and other beers on tap.

The bartender, however, claimed he made a mean basil gimlet.  Anyone who knows me knows I head only to 83 Proof for this stuff, but a couple of my friends gave him a chance.

MOVE OVER, 83 - - 540's basil gimlet ROCKED.

540 also has several tables and chairs outside for smokers.  Bing bing bing - additional points.  It becomes a perfect good-weather "grab a beer" spot instantly.

It's far.  It's at Clement and 7th, and takes me a whopping 20 minutes to get here.  Parking should have been pretty difficult (common in this area), except I scored royalty parking right across the street.  The decor is cozy and casual - there is nothing fancy about this bar, but it makes for a cool hangout with friends.  But it's still WAY out there, far from the other more popular hangouts.

Well, that said - the business consultant in me says that 540 could be packed all night long (instead of being sparsely populated like it was when I was there) with the right marketing, and become a favorite "happy hour" spot in the city if they would make "happy hour" all night long.  Some time ago, Palomino (located on Embarcadero, no less) changed their happy hour to a "happy hour every day, all day" policy, and since then, it's been a packed house.  In this economy, cheap drinks and a location with lots of eateries immediately catapults a business as a "GREAT" hangout.

Unfortunately, the confusing $1 from ___ to ___ and $2 on other days for this and that makes it confusing.

That confusion prevents me from giving this place four-stars.  It's not the bar's fault that their happy hour time limitations weren't reviewed accurately by all Yelpers, but throw in the location (Richmond - no parking - cold) and I'm not that thrilled about it.  

But factor in the fabulous basil gimlets and the great beers on tap - and I can't help but throw in one more star.  It's not a four-star location by any means, but it's just *kinda* cool anyway.
author: Grace K.

description:
I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place already. Every time I've come in here - whether meeting friends, after browsing green apple, or on dates - I've always have a good time.

The artwork is generally evocative and they have a stellar selection of beers. They've also got one of the best jukeboxes in the city. I've never been given attitude by any of the barkeeps. And I've had some funny conversations with some of the regulars over the years.

Definitely one of my favorite bars in the city.
author: Art O.

description: Came here day drinking after class. The place was deserted. The drinks were strong and priced ok. But I doubt I would ever come here again, not my kind of scene. The music was weird and the bathroom was dirty.
author: Karina A.

description:
I've been a little cranky as of late.

Part of it has to do with work, part of it has to do with a few friendships falling out, hell I'm sure part of it has to do with some moon in my astrological chart in retrograde. All I know is that the thick layer of gray fog that's draped over the Richmond this summer has been really matching my mental mood. 

But as uplifting as a daily patch of sunshine, I have found some comfort in 540 Club. For starters, though its conveniently located on busy Clement Street, the tables in front for outdoor smoking and puppy parking feel somewhat secluded from the chaos just feet away. Inside houses the right shade of darkness at anytime of day. The beer choices on tap usually has some interesting selections. For example, I am thrilled that they currently have Deschuetes Jubel Once in a Decade Ale on tap. Btw if you are reading this review months from now they will have this brew back on tap in March 2011. They usually carry something special from the Lagunitas line. An internet jukebox and pool table round out your distractions/ mood enhancers. 

The entire staff recently won the dubious award for Crankiest Bartender in San Francisco. An honor like that brings a smile to my face. Actually lots of the people who come here bring on the grins. From the large doberman named Layla who likes to flop out wherever she feels like it to the morning elderly drinkers and to countless tattoos, this place is perfect for a comfortable drink. Cheers.
author: Veronica G.

description:
Bouncer told me straight up I looked cracked up and high in my driver's license picture that was taken when I was 15 years old. The bartenders were pleasant, the place was a little divey, and the $4.00 shots we had were awesomely tasty and strong.

Crowd was nice too. Met some Scottish fellas who downed our last drinks for us and served as the obligatory cameraman. 

Awesome, chill night with wonderful friends.
author: Jennie T.

description: Great bar awesome bartender! Drinks are cheap and it is a casual atmosphere where I can take my pup!
author: Hg4389 G.

description:
My boyfriend and I wanted to do something on a Friday night and thanks to yelp, we found this place. From the moment I walked in, I felt a good vibe. People were celebrating birthdays, relieving themselves after a long week of work, and a DJ was spinning good classics. As previously advised, their drink prices are pretty good. I ordered two glasses of beer on tap and it cost $9 total. However, wish I knew it was CASH only. My bf had to run to the atm (which luckily was around the block) and get some cash while I sat there babysitting our drinks. The bartenders were very nice. =) The birthday girl there received a free shot of some kind with cherries and a candle cleverly sitting on top. I don't mind coming back if some friends wanted to check out a local bar. 

Quick tip: Cash only.
author: Johanna P.

description: I stopped in for a beer, almanac, $10/glass, because they have a patio and i have a dog. Never been inside, but folks outside were chatty and sociable. The beer was great, first had it at dynamo donuts, but $10 seemed high. The patio is small, more a portico for smokers than anything.
author: Kelly K.

description: Super friendly bartenders! Cheap drinks. Chill and relaxing environment. Good music. And free candy canes!
author: Amy X.

description:
Probably the classiest dive bar ever.  Extra points for being within walking distance.

They make their margs with no mix - just the way they should!  

Decor consists of work from local artists and various Giants memorabilia.

I went in on a Thursday and was pleased to find that it was not busy - and also had a live DJ spinning chill beats.  It's nice to have a drink in a dive that isn't totally littered with hipsters and college co-eds.

Also went in last Sunday and enjoyed a beer on the outside porch with some friends.  A great way to end the weekend.

Points to the relaxed bartender who made my drink - many thanks for giving me the extras in a separate glass.  Hats off.
author: Carmel U.

description:
My cousin and his fiancee from Italy came. And they did not ACCEPT their passport and IDS. And we obviously look in our late 20s. 

The bouncer did not believe any of their formal documents. ERGH! Thanks for nothing. 

Sorry 540, I wish I had a chance to actually experience you.
author: Cheryl P.

description:
The 540 Club...not really a club, just a bar, but don't get upset! So totally worth a stop by if you're in the neighborhood having drinks and being neighborly in general!

First of all, if you love beer and beer on tap and a large selection of beer and being with other beer drinkers and beer nuts, definitely come by, any time, I assure you, you shant be disappointed! if you're more inclined to imbibe with a mixed drink or 3, get over here on Monday! Monday! Monday!!!  for the $1.00 drink specials! A divine thing in this harsh economic climate! Just because the world is falling apart and the US Dollar is in the cellar doesn't mean you shouldn't have your drinks and drink 'em too!!!  (Still, as one Yelper aptly pointed out, this isn't top shelf liquor...it's more like "Kirkland Signature Whiskey" but after a couple, it's all good!!!!

This place has fun bartenders, a charming outdoor patio, great jukey and a cracking Pub Quiz Night on Sundays!!!

Parking in the area bites because it is the horror of Clement St, so there are always 100's of cars circling when you are!  You may get lucky on one of the side streets (and I'm referring to parking)  but one consolation is;  Once you've parked...you've parked! There are so many other pubs/eateries/coffee shops within a 4-5 block radius you will not have to keep parking/re parking!!!  Bonus if you "arrive after 5" cause the meters go off at 6 so you won't be trotting outside to keep the DPT witches away!!!
author: Karen S.

description:
You reaaaaally can't hate $1 drinks.

But that's not love.

No, this is love:

Having the drunk dude you stumble in front of in the bathroom line which you hadn't realized was the bathroom line telling you, very gently, that there's 1) a line and 2) a much much cleaner hidden girls-only bathroom around the way.  Having all the guys waiting patiently in line laugh and chime in helpfully.  Drunkenness that brings out the manners and not the douchebaggery in its regulars?  LOVE.
author: Pam Z.

description: The feminist bouncer was hilarious when asking a group of rude college kids to leave. Definitely comming back!!!
author: Sam S.

description:
This is a solid local bar I'm happy to frequent.  

Good priced drinks, eclectic DJ, some nice beers on tap including leff, quirky movies on the plasma TVs and the projector above... there is just something about this place that says home to me.

The decor is a bit ratty but this place definitely has some history.
author: Theron L.

description: cute neighborhood bar with a pink elephant obsession. Good to go for a beer maybe watch a game
author: Pamela I.

description:
Monday- $1 drink night. This is pretty much all I've been here for, mostly because summer school had tests every monday morning, and we would celebrate here at night. We lived one block away and walked by it everyday, and never really went in other than monday nights. Strangely enough the monday night crowd is rather awful and I would have prefered coming in for an afternoon beer or something. go figure. 

Tuesday- $2 cocktail night. Never went in for this one, but sounds fun.
author: AL S.

description: This is a great little cozy bar in san fran to hit if you want to have a few drinks and catch up with your friends. Their prices are fair and the bartender was really nice.
author: nate s.

description: Got some spicy bloody Mary's there this morning before the Giants game. My sister just moved to the neighborhood and I will be returning lots and lots. Great bloody Mary with homemade base, cute English bull dog hanging out and cheap prices what's not to like? Bloody Mary was only $6 a pop with lots of kick. Enjoy and bring your cash- cash only kids. Looking forward to returning.
author: Sarah R.

description:
This place is great.  It's definitely filled with locals and people from the neighbourhood, there are a lot of fun events here, there's always some random B-movie or just a classic throwback, cute fish in the tank, and a really nice bartender. With cheap drinks, and all that? How can you go wrong?

Frequenting this place more often, that's for sure!
author: Lauren S.

description:
I have been told this place got the award for Crankiest Bartenders in SF. There is only one cranky bartender to my knowledge. There is a young asian woman and a psychobilly rocker guy who have always served us with a smile. One time the aforementioned woman even remembered a drink she had specially made my girlfriend a month previous. 

As a rule I think this place is pretty hit or miss for me. It seems as if it is either a) wall to wall jammed or b) deserted. To be fair, I have attended a few dollar drink nights and those are always jammed for the most part but I think thats an accurate assessment. I usually start my night with this bar and move on to greener pastures later (Bitter End, Irelands, Plough and Stars) to end the night on a relaxed note.

But cheers to this place. The bouncer is a really huge guy but he is reasonable and not a huge dick even though they do ID extremely hard and turn away passports.
author: Jay C.

description:
There's really nothing better than have a Tom Collins underneath a giant stuffed Octopus. I love the 540 Club, but now I love it even more. I'm sad I won't be able to make it to the 80's Prom Party. 

All the bartenders are skilled in making delicious cocktails, I usually go for a Gin Martini or a Tom Collins, which are nice and cheap, and the bartenders are always friendly and have great insight into the SF scene. 

There are always plenty of scenesters and an eclectic mix of music. Sometimes it smells bad, but I give it an extra star for that, it adds to the flavor.
author: Julia H.

description:
Monday nights, 10 pm - midnight, $1 well drinks.

I really don't have any complaints about this situation.

It's just kind of nice to know there's a place I can give myself alcohol poisoning for less than $10.
author: Patty P.

description: My regular happy hour spot. Pool tables in the back, outside patio area out front. Friendly bar-tenders, friendly drinkin' crowd, friendly dogs :) Bring cash.
author: Brook R.

description:
This is my kind of dive. Bitchin' pool table, strong cocktails and a solid jukebox. Bartenders are cool and so is the owner. What more do you want?

You may find me at the pool table as often as I can get out there. I live in SOMA, so its a bit of a hike. This is the only bar in SF I've been to that you can play a game on Saturday night and not have to maneuver through a herd of people in order to take each shot. Even though I recently found a spot in my hood, I plan to come back regularly just to mix it up.

Good times.
author: Erich N.

description:
Don't know when the surly bartender works, but it wasn't at 8pm on a Saturday.  Mickey was working, and she was quite the ray of sunshine on what otherwise was a "cold as balls" evening in the richmond.  Good amount of beers on tap, I had the limited release Lagunitas in a nice chilled pint glass.  The shanghainess was feeling a little full from our meal at The House, so Mickey suggested a Fernet with Ginger Ale.  An interesting mix as a digistif, it made her feel better and Mickey checked back with us multiple times to make sure everything was good.  

Worth the stop on your way along clement or in our case on the way home to the ORD.
author: Pablo E.

description:
A great local place to get a reasonably priced drink.  Friendly staff.  Relaxed atmosphere.  $3.50 well drinks.

My only complaint is that the music is so loud it's difficult to socialize.  The tables are small but I still couldn't hear anyone unless they sat right next to me.  Two feet away across the table is too far to hear anything.

Bike Parking: Luckily 540 Club has an awning and you can lock up to the posts.
author: Jean K.

description:
You have to love a bar with a drunk bartender. 

This was a true dive bar. We drank beer that was not horrible and played darts. 

The drunk bartender was nice enough but he insisted that the beer was 10 dollars a glass. I handed him a 10 for two and he gave me change. It was a little weird. I really could not tell if he was joking or serious.

Their juke box is the type that allows you to download songs that are not already loaded. Yep, it is so easy to drop cash into this thing since it takes credit cards... DANGEROUS!!!

Finally, I really dig the space. I think this place has quite a bit of potential. In the back is a little former disco area. It looks like they were spinning beegees in the 70s. The sober bartender (who arrived later) said that they have a dj in here sometimes. It would be worth seeing.

Our music choices included Bright Eyes, Sublime, NOFX, David Bowie, and Black Sabbath (we were feeling eclectic) and the crowd seemed to roll with it. Thats always good :-)
author: Eric G.

description: The bartender I forget her name was a nice young girl. I'd been drinking there for over an hour and had four drinks and was about to order some more when it turned 7:15 and the owner turned the tvs to the Giants game. I had been siting there for over an hour watching the Red Sox game and it was now in the 9th and not going to go on too much longer. I asked the bartender if she could turn one tv to the Red Sox game so I could finish it and she checked with the owner and he said no even though she explained to him the situation. I will never go there to drink or watch a game again.
author: Steve Q.

description:
Ok, the bartenders here get 5 stars.

The problem is with the owner. He's an ass and likes to call people gay or fag. I didn't know people still said that in SF. 

It really sucks to have the owner of a bar try and insult you for spending money at his bar.

I personally will never go here again, but I recommend the bar tenders as they make amazing drinks.
author: Nate K.

description: The bartender was really awesome and friendly when we went. Drinks were cheap and it was generally just a really good time. :)
author: Trisha D.

description: Stay away unless your unless you want to be nominated into the lamest collective of hipsters the richmond district has to offer!
author: RYAN Y.

description: This place has been here for such a long time and its such a cool local hang out bar. The bartenders are super nice and its nice that they have a few outdoor seats in the front.  I love that they have local artists' artwork displayed on their walls and they are available for sale.  Such a great way to give back to your community. One thing they should invest on is re-upholstering the banquets. It looks like its been there since the joint opened and its all cracked and ugly looking.  Who knows whats been growing in between those cracks...
author: Gina S.

description:
Just to be clear 540 Club is not a club. The name and their website are a little misleading. That being said, this a great little bar. It is certainly nothing fancy but a good place to go for a drink. The bartenders are what make this bar, they are very friendly and take their drink making very seriously. They really care if a cocktail they made is good. They also have a pretty big selection of beers on tap, from a PBR for $2 to a Guinness for $5, you'll find something you like. 

If you don't like a big crowd then stay away on Mondays from 10-12 because they have $2 well drinks and it turns into a mad house. 

In general 540 is a fun and simple place to go for some good drinks.
author: Thomas A.

description:
R.I.P. 540 Room.

Anyone familiar with the bars on Clement will understand this. 540 is the new (old) Rockit Room.

I basically had my ID cavity searched last night, and after walking two steps past the door got a flashlight in my face from the bouncer (who was not the usual 540 bouncer) telling me out was "out." He told me I had to leave because I "swapped IDs," which I'm not 100% sure what that means, and walked me to the exit. No explanation, no let me see your ID again, just Goodbye.

Bummer experience, and I don't plan on going back to the 540 Room anytime soon. The Chartreuse at the Dirty Trix taste just the same anyhow.
author: Doug M.

description:
The first time I was here was a weekend night. It was bat-shit wild. So packed we could barely move. I met my pal's new-at-the-time girlfriend.  She had some reeeal wacky theory about the Midwest that was borderline offensive. Then I remembered she was like 12 years old.

Naw, not that they serve minors in here. I'm just saying, she was a young'un in terms of having seen much of the country outside of Cali or NY.  Eh, but limited experience means I really couldn't blame her. As much as I love California, it's so unfair to lump together everyplace from Phoenix to Pittsburgh as purely "fly-over" and similar to each other.

Ok, so I digress... but the point of that was to say that my first time hanging out at 540 was a bit surreal, and I didn't really feel super-compelled to return, though it was for reasons that weren't really the bar's fault.

...but I found myself over here again last night, and it was relaxed, not too expensive, not overly packed. Some guy even had his beagle chillin' with him.  

Without quite so many people, I got to more fully appreciate their lovely elephant motif -- I'm a sucker for old pink-elephant cocktail paraphernalia --and grab a few glasses of wine from a truly friendly barkeep, and catch up with my boys. 

I think the idea of returning on a weekend night still makes me feel a little claustrophobic, but if I found myself in the Richmond, I'd certainly stop in on a weeknight in a heartbeat.
author: mariah c.

description: I love this bar for its pool table and awesome bartenders! Great place to watch the Giants too! Good vibes and no complaints :)
author: Michele G.

description:
I've frequented this establishment a disproportionate number of times considering its distance from my home.  That alone speaks volumes of this cozy neighborhood pub.

The front patio often becomes very crowded with people who enjoy both smoking and drinking and laughing and carousing and generally misbehaving.  (On the record, I do not condone any of those practices.  Please drink responsibly.)

What really makes this place truly memorable are the special events.  The annual Catholic School Girl Karaoke night should not be missed by anyone.  Ever.  (On the record, I fully endorse themed events at bars and restaurants.)
author: Christopher K.

description: This is a pretty chill bar. It attracts an interesting and diverse crowd. I can't say too much about the drinks but it seems like a great place to sit with some pals. We crashed some random birthday party but they didn't seem to mind. I don't know if the bar stools are good for bootilicious booty dances, so I'll have to go back and test that theory. Overall, I like this place.
author: Amy J.

description:
Every part of the world has their own sacred icon. India has their cows, Spain has their bulls and in the Richmond we have the 540 club. 

This is the local bar of choice for those who live out in the far away land of the Richmond. If this is your first time visiting you might walk past the place. It's like a mirage in a sea of Dim Sum shops, bargain stores and about 10,000 pink bags. It stands out like a hooker in the Sunset.. don't get me wrong.. I'm not opposed to both. 

Walking through Clement street you will absolutely notice this place. You'll feel the vibe of the drunken people sitting sitting in the infamous front porch.. belching, smoking drinking.. but most importantly screaming at each other in English! If you live near Clement then you know exactly how important that is. (sorry guys..I'm Asian and I ended up doing hand signs when trying to order at Good Luck Dim Sum). 

But don't let the drunkard fool you. The patrons and bartenders here are cool. You got your typical list of beers on tap and a full bar behind it. Drinks aren't expensive and they do have dollar beer night and other specials (I think Tues and Sat) for well drinks. BBQ on Sundays with $2 drinks. You get a DJ spinning on some nights too. 

That porch is a godsend. If you and your dog can put up with smokers then you can bring him along. Just note..  if you're a guy don't bring a white furry 3lb Maltese with you. I took a lot of sh*t for that.. 

They also have a giant plasma screen usually playing anime. Seriously, drinks, darts, DJ spinning, dollar drink night and anime. WTF else would you want.......?




The hooker in the Sunset? I made that up you pervert.
author: Dan T.

description:
Please stop coming here. You will hate it.

I don't. I fucking love this place. Great bartenders, awesome doorman (fuck you if you don't like him - your IQ is probably about 1/10 of his anyway), and the owner kicks ass. The crowd is mellow and fun and not at all pretentious. Let's keep it that way.

Like I said, please stay away.
author: Suge K.

description:
There are good days and bad days. On the bad days, at least you've still got booze. That line of thought is what landed me at 540 Club by 4 p.m. on Tuesday. And that line of thought is what got my beer/vodka card all stamped up by 6 p.m. That line of thought + the incredibly cheap drinks at 540 Club is what inspired me to CONTINUE drinking well into the wee hours.

Truth be told, this isn't really the kind of place I'd usually spend a lot of time at. It's divey and musty and it seems like every other dive bar in the Inner Richmond and throughout the city. But the bartenders are incredibly nice, the regulars aren't one bit creepy, and the crowd is great. And cute boys go there. And there's a dartboard. And I got obliterated for around $30. And I got laid. No I didn't. But that's ok because I've still got booze.
author: Autumn K.

description:
I'm still thinking................................

update coming soon!

7/20/07 Just updated: 
It was after Keane's show at Ireland 32 that some of us wanted to go to 540 club, this is where I met Sammy S. I don't remember most of the first time I meet these yelp friends of mine but this I remembered. It was the night where I ask her where Suge because I saw her dog, she pointed to her and I finally found who she was. I've been reading and admiring Suge's style of writing and her comments she makes on Yelp. She is fierce yet sweet in person. On the other hand, you have Sammy, total dork, silly, and a goober at most. Imagine this, you see a girl at a bar and she is dresses like the president's daughter, what do you say to her? 

I'm a republican!
author: Stanley K.

description:
I love this bar and just don't make it here enough. And it is not even far from where I live. It is especially nice when you want to have a drink or two with a couple of friends and want to avoid the bullshit of nightclubs and hipsters and douches in striped shirts. Clement is off the beaten path and out of the way of tourists and bridge-n-tunnelers which leads to a more mellow, down to earth crowed. 

Sometimes its nice to avoid the meat markets, ego parades, and vanity fests and just enjoy a cider, music, and good company.
author: Miss Kae O.

description:
Stopped by here with friends, because I heard it was THE place for this week's DYL. 

Closed the place down.

Took multiple shots of multiple things.  Including Frenet, which rhymes with my name, which makes it taste better. 

Convinced myself I should kneel obnoxiously on the bar stools while waiting for drinks.  Note to self: Maybe cute when I was smaller and younger, but not-so-much anymore.

Unfortunately, above acts led to me sleeping until noon.  I woke up with my sparkly shoes still on and minus an earring. 

It's now 5 pm, and I haven't eaten anything other than a bowl of chocolate ice cream.  

Liver, mission accomplished: You've been destroyed.

----------------------------------------------------
Update:  Neil C. pointed out that it's spelled Fernet and doesn't really rhyme with my name.  So I ruined my liver for nothing.  Great, just great.
author: Janney B.

description:
540 is the perfect dive bar, except that they don't have shuffleboard and the girls bathroom sucks. 

I have been to 540 three times:

1) Catholic school karaoke night, March 2007. Imagine a catholic school soft-porn. I highly recommend it. 

2) Sunday after Catholic School karaoke night. So, I lost my phone at Catholic karaoke night and just stopped by to see if it was at the bar. (btw on Sundays, 540 busts out a grill and cooks up some mean food.) Eight Miller High Lifes, two burgers and zero cell phones later... you get the idea. 

3) A typical Friday night with a bunch of yelpers. It was crowded! But the bartenders were still quick.


I may or may not have made out in the men's bathroom on one of these occasions.
author: Kathryn T.

description:
Not that this place really needs more positive reviews, but I had such a great experience with them that I feel the need to add to the gush-fest here on Yelp.  

Here's the story: My birthday was coming up, and with a couple weeks to go, I was looking for a fun neighborhood bar to host a party.  I didn't need anything special, just a spot that would be happening but not packed with people, that would have fun music, good drinks, and my friends would be able to come and go as they pleased.

I checked out the website, and after realizing it hadn't been updated in a few years, decided I should give them a call.  I'm not sure who I spoke with, but he was fun and helpful, telling me what a typical Friday night looks like.  It sounded good, so I sent out an email to my friends, and then a couple of days before my birthday I realized I never actually told the 540 Club I'd be having a bunch of people swarm their bar.  I stopped in a couple of days before, and ended up meeting the owner.  He was super friendly, and told me he'd be happy to have me have my party there (phew!), that they never rent the place out for private events so it wouldn't be a problem.  He thanked me for thinking of them and told me maybe he'd blow up some balloons for me with the helium tank he had in the back, haha.

Fast forward to the night of my birthday...I show up about 8:45 and snag one of the side tables with some friends.  They have a DJ playing in the back, near the dart boards.  All of the staff is super accommodating and friendly.  I had balloons tied to my wrist by the owner, and the bartender had the entire bar sing to me, giving me a shot that had a candle in it.  How cool is that?

Thank you to everyone at 540 Club for making my Friday the 13th birthday super fun!
author: Lindsay B.

description:
It's actually Section 25660, which is pretty much the same thing except this code applies to bars and the other applies to liquor stores and the like.

Also, I understand that they're a bit more reasonable now in enforcing the policy, and as such they'll get a 4.5 in my book.

And with that, this is the last time I'll update this review as I'm starting to really annoy the shit out of me...
author: Sus... B.

description:
Check list of things a dive bar NEEDS to make me flip my lid:

-A hot female bartender who smiles rather than glares to earn her tips, and can pull off a bustier without it appearing slutty.

-A constant dog party and the presence of one giant black lover, Mr. Suge Knight, the real D-O-G.

-A plethora of pink elephant decorations to match my hot, hot, hot elephant Vans.

-Never-ending PBRs, which ultimately means I have enough cab fare to get my drunk ass home to the other end of the world (thanks to Zomb E. and Cat W. for introducing me to the greatest cheap beer of all time).

-A skinny white boy DJ with a hipster top hat who dances with the three people on the dance floor who have been  boogieing all night!

-A flamboyant, fabulous man who dances with his eyes shut while swinging back and forth with his hands flopping loosely up near his armpits.

-An obscure movie from the 80s  that no one has ever heard of, or is watching, playing on the wall above the dance floor.

-The unexpected infiltration of Yelpers, who neither acknowledged my presence or remember who I am (although I was asked if I was Suge, since I was hanging with the most famous Yelp Dog), which allowed me full access to watch, and laugh at them. Except for the ever wonderful Kelly H. who allowed me to keep my anonymity! And the woman behind Mr. Suge, the real D-O-G!

-The company of the coolest couple to hit the Inner Richmond!

Stars all around 540! Except I'm mentally taking away one star for being so damn far from anything I usually associate myself with.
author: Sammy S.

description:
Every DYL starts the same. 

"I'll go for a few drinks, then leave." WRONG! I inevitably wake up two days later, having lost my money and dignity, and gained a giant headache and tremors large enough to warrant recording by the US Geological Survey. My moth-eaten memory only remembers bits and pieces until triggers unveil periodic revelations of the debaucherous shenanigans. 

That being said, cheap, stiff-*ss drinks and good company. You only live once, right?
author: Suzanne R.

description:
The building that houses the 540 club appears to have been built in the early 20th century and has tons of character. With a bit (more precisely, a whole lot) of restoration, this would be a beautiful space to sit and drink after work or on a weekend afternoon.

However, to pay for the restoration they'd probably have to do away with the very reasonable drink specials, and they'd end up replacing of the friendly bartenders with a couple snooty chicks clad in black, and the regulars from the neighborhood would be uncomfortable here and start going somewhere else, and you could forget about ever playing darts here again. 

As much as it would be nice to see the filthy cheap carpet torn out and that back area that looks like a toolshed cleaned up, The downtown bar set isn't coming out to 5th and clement to drink and the locals aren't going to pay six bucks for an anchor steam. No one benefits.

I don't live in the richmond, but I'm sure I'd be sentimental about this place as it is if I did.
author: matthew r.

description:
