In another life, I would have gladly given the 540 hundreds of stars and heaps of praise, for the reasons that have already been enumerated here. And in a sense (the sense that enjoys cheap cocktails and good music), I still really do like the 540.  

But, for very specific reasons (some nostalgic and bittersweet, some imagined in my insane ruminating head and others unimagined and extremely concrete and several blocks away), I cringe at the very mention of the bar's name in conversation and when I walk into this place, I  immediately become overwhelmed with the severity of my own angst.  

So, to my friends who suggest 540, here's a tip: don't, unless you want to see your fragile Brooklyn flower of a friend shrivel up into a crying, paranoid mess. 

(4 stars for objectivity; the bar has nothing to do with my own personal bullshit)
author: Maria D.

description:
Where all the yelpers know your name....

The Friday night bartenders, Bronx and Brian, are absolutely amazing! Fast and friendly service in a packed bar is a rare thing these days, and they gracefully handle both.
author: Aim E.

description:
The only place where you can dress up like a Catholic Schoolgirl and have a not so nasty conversation.
Hot damn!
look at these women reliving the dream! 
Including myself. 
That was probably the shortest skirt I have EVAR worn.
But the top of the evening was singing 
Highway to Hell at the end of the night .
Now all I need is another straight up bourbon and a fake cigarette because i don't smoke and someday i will be a poser, but not today!
Thanks to the bouncer who bounced out the ass monkey who stalked me TWICE to the bathroom. You're my fucking hero. 
Once bitten, twice shy, come on baby it's do or die singing Karaoke.
Live bitches, Live!

ROCK N ROLL!
author: J A.

description:
Four stars for the bar, 5 stars for Catholic School Karaoke!

I rarely go to the inner Richmond to hang out...oh alright, I NEVER go to the inner Richmond to hang out.  Other than buying a mattress, getting a new car battery and my eyebrows waxed, I've spent very little time in a neighborhood that is relatively close to me!

But when I heard of Catholic School Karaoke I was in!  This bar seems like a local hang out...great (but small) outdoor patio, plenty of tables inside (well, for a small bar) and a long bar area.  The bartenders were friendly and relatively quick considering how many people were there.  And to be honest, you can't go wrong with a bar that serves Stella in a proper Stella glass (that is until they run out of them!) ;-)

I'd definitely consider coming here again for a night where you just want to chill and hang out with friends...no pretention and seems and not a frat bar.
author: Melanie N.

description:
Based on the fuzzy memory of my one visit here...

The staff rocks.
What a down ass group of cool heads.
The beer selection is solid.
And that night, the music was too.

And even though I could barely stand and was probably making a complete ass of myself,
I didn't get 86'd

I don't remember much, other than I had a blast.

Thanks for the memories?
author: Sim city slicker S.

description:
How can you not give five stars to a bar which serves BBQ on Sundays?

I love this bar - always have, always will.

The dancing DJ is fabulous, the drinks are well priced... they allow doggies in the bar (!!)  Awesome place!

Not to mention that on slower nights you can play what is the most awesome punk rock jukebox in the city... filled with tons o' old skool tunes which make me reminisce about playing them on some other jukebox in some other bar in some other city... :)

Yay, 540 you make me happy!
author: Kate R.

description:
Not the worst bar I've ever been to, not the greatest either. Oddly, I popped in here one Saturday night and realize I have been in here before, years ago. Man, I can't believe I've lived in San Francisco for 5 years now. God I'm old...

Anyway, I digress. This bar has great art, and I have to admit, the clientele was nice to look at, but other than that, I can't say I'm the biggest fan, mostly because there are about a half dozen bars near my house with the same atmosphere. Don't get me wrong, if I lived near the 540 I'm sure I'd be here all the time, but I don't  so I'm not. But the jukebox is one of those fancy eCast jobs which is cool, but it's a little loud in here. The leather on the seats against the wall are torn and a little beat up, which make for a good dive bar I suppose. 

What made it for me the last time I was in here, I randomly ran into my coworker Jae and the bartender was super wasted. A couple of good ingredients for a good random night. It would have only been topped if I was a little more drunk and stole a car with some girl I went to high school with or something like that...
author: Michael E.

description: I used to go here back in the day, but only on Mondays.  I just moved back to the neighborhood and I'm glad they still have $1 wells on Mondays.   Luckily the Giants won the World Series on a Monday.  Thanks for 540, I celebrated right!
author: Kimba V.

description:
I love this bar!

Great wait staff. DJs spinning. Reasonably priced drinks.

And I also love the poster art on the walls.

I will definately be back.

Special thanks to Mickey (sp) as she is the best bartender ever!
author: Rebecca Y.

description:
$5 Bushmills and ginger? In San Francisco? Yes.

Friendly pups cuddling with patrons? Yes.

True dive bar, port-a-potty (tm, laura b.) stench? Yes!
author: Michie L.

description:
To be honest, the place isn't anything out of the ordinarily special nor is it that great... but, when you got like 6 of your friends drinking with ya -- the 540 is the best place to be.

Small little dive on Clement with plenty of locals wearing their work clothes and some hipster kids bumping in for the rocking DJ and cheap drinks.  Yes, the drinks are super cheap, so buying rounds for your friends won't hurt.  The bartenders are the most efficient and fast that I've seen in the city (the female bartender was unbelievable at remembering my drunk order of 238437 types of drinks for the rest of my chums).  And the DJ was hilariously good at mixing in 80s with house/techno stuff.  

Honestly, when you're feeling like a few to kickback with friends and meet some friendly locals, get enough drinks in you to wiggle (aka dance) near the kegs, and get confused in the long corridor to the way to the bathroom, come here!
author: Vicky B.

description:
Really 4.5, but screw it, I haven't done a 5 star review in awhile.

The biggest problem with the 540 is that it is out in Bumblefuck.  OK it's not really in bumblefuck, but that's what I say whenever I have to take Muni somewhere beyond the four block radius of my apartment.

They have an EXCELLENT selection of beer, and I didn't get charged more than 3.50 for anything, prime-time on a Friday night.  There was a DJ who played music 80's through today, and he was awesome because he didn't pump up the music too loud.

It was crowded but comfortable.

Did I mention that my bus caught fire on the way over?
author: Rocco B.

description:
Ultra-chill bar.  The lighting is nice and dark with candles at all the tables.  Drapes run above your head to make the ceiling feel lower, and the whole place feel more intimate.

The music is kept at an ideal volume -- loud enough to feel the groove, but low enough to let you speak without yelling.

The bartender was just awesome.  She was friendly, gave great recommendations, kept the drinks hard, and worked the place efficiently.

No pretension, good crowd, and excellent drinks.
author: Chris Q.

description:
I thought I'd give them a second chance because honestly I wasn't really feeling this bar the first time around.  Case in point, the bartender popped open a new scotch and whose tit got hit by the cork?  Yep, that would be me.  Then I noticed my hoodie was drenched in scotch.  Yeah fun times.  But anyway, that was the first visit.

Second time around was awesome.  Went with a couple of Canadian buddies and a couple of my pub quiz regulars.  Sat against the wall (wise decision on my part) so any bartender acrobatics were avoided thankfully.  We won for best team name, YES!   That's right:  Blame Canada.  A pint of Prohibition Ale was enjoyed by all along with $5 on the jukebox.  We picked all Canadian songs just to rub it in everyone's faces.  Ahh good times.  It's nice going in there with low expectations and leaving a happy camper.  One star off for not being the Boardroom's pub quiz.  :P  Hey, it's called free speech bitches.  Appreciate.  :)
author: Emily C.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night with my gf to relax and have a few drinks. We've been here a couple of times and it has yet to disappoint, actually she's the one who brought me here on one of our first dates. ;-)

The clientele is usually a pretty mixed crowd, but heavier on the piercings, tatts, and punk rock/rockabilly style. My kind of place, especially when they're playing punk rock! Expect funny impromptu theme nights, last time I was there the Suicide Girls were doing a book signing and this past Saturday was Catholic School Girl/Clergy night. This may end up being my new local bar.

Definitely worth checking out and good for a change of pace from the rest of SF, especially when trying to get away from the douchebags.
author: Gary T.

description:
Last night I went to 540 club with some friends, one of whom is visiting from Canada - surprise, we encountered the infamous "540 club passport policy" as mentioned in other reviews.

As Susannah B points out (http://www.abc.ca.gov/forms/abc299.pdf) , this policy is _not_ state law (nor would it seem to be if anyone spent more than 5 seconds thinking about the implications of this "law": no foreign visitors able to drink legally in California? Come on, folks, use your heads.  It is also clear that this policy is not required because passports lack physical descriptors, as my friends passport has these descriptors.

My pet theory is that this place has had problems with ABC before due to underage drinking and have decided to run no more risks, perhaps for fear of losing their liquor license.  It's also believable that underage drinkers were slipping past their Sherlock Holmes bouncer with unfamiliar forms of identification.  So, in keeping with a "locals only" clubhouse mentality, someone decided to enforce a unique, draconian, and fallacious interpretation of ID requirements in California. 

Now, to be clear, I don't blame the bouncer, or even the smoking area peanut gallery who were quick to point out that this was "the law" (it isn't) - my problem is with the management.  Clearly this is their policy, and although I recognize they are free to enforce it, I am similarly free to write a disappointed review and to never patronize this place again.
author: joe b.

description:
Dear 540 Club,

You should have probably sent me the memo that everyone in this bar dresses only in black, and that if I don't have some sort of tattoo I might just be too wholesome for these sorts of establishments.

Despite my fashion faux-pas of bright colors and a perky pony tail, I still had a great time at this bar.  The clientele was friendly, even with their love of mourning, and the bartenders were great.  Approachable, and funny, they served us numerous, and the cheapest, drinks I've found in the city so far.  Mixed drinks started at $3.50, and PBR/cheap beers ran $2.00.  Amen 540, amen.

Things to note at this bar:  The men's bathroom is in an area one would commonly mistake for a co-ed bathroom.  The women's bathroom is to the right in a hallway behind the bar.  Not that I walked into the wrong bathroom or anything (many apologies to the guy in the striped shirt).  The bathroom walls have many great personal achievements written on the walls, and make taking a pee quite educational.

People seem to pair up quickly at this bar, and there is no shortage of come-ons.  Albeit strange ones.

The guy who controls the music at this bar, well, he just makes me happy.  And that bouncer...I've never met a friendlier guy who's also managed to intimidate the crap outta me.  

Don't worry 540 club- next time I'll wear more black.  I ain't mad 'atcha.
author: Christy B.

description:
1. DMV-employee-esque bouncers.
2. Horrible mainstream 80's music jukebox. 
3. Corny crowd.
author: jette s.

description:
What can I say about the 540 that hasn't been said below. The drinks are cheap, the music is good, the crowd is friendly, and the bartenders are generally good people - though I don't know the latest generation all that well. 

Having gone to law school right up the hill at USF, I've come to love the place, so I feel compelled to clarify the whole passport issue via a 5 min google search - though if you had a run in with Ken on the issue, I'm sure he explained it at the time. 

All bars within the state of California are governed by CA Business and Professions Code 25660 which, in relevant part,  states: 

25660. (a) Bona fide evidence of majority and identity of the 
person is a document issued by a federal, state, county, or municipal 
government, or subdivision or agency thereof, including, but not 
limited to, a motor vehicle operator's license or an identification 
card issued to a member of the Armed Forces, that contains the name, 
date of birth, description, and picture of the person. 

The last line is the key - the "[b]ona fide evidence of majority  . . .that contains the name, date of birth, description, and picture of the person." 

Now go look at your passport. Note it has your name, date of birth and a picture of you. So by process of elimination, what is it missing? That's right kiddies - a description. Unlike a valid drivers license it does not have your height, weight, eye color and hair color, therefore it does not meet the CA requirements. If your ID does not meet these requirements,  540 cannot claim the affirmative defense of reliance on a state/federal ID in subsection c of the above code. 

They are just following the CA law that other bars break on a daily basis. It has nothing to do with whether or not Jamie (the owner) et. al.  "realiz[es] that San Francisco is full of Europeans, South American, Canadian, Asian and African nationals." 

It is akin to taking a taxi home at the end of a drunken night instead of driving - some people are willing to risk the headache of police involvement to save a buck (or in this case make a buck) and some aren't. 540 falls into the latter. In the long run it is better for business. 

Now stop your crying and get on with your life.
author: Brendan W.

description: Solid 4 star bar. Ventured out of SOMA and ended up way out in the Richmond for a day after New Year's Eve football watching extravaganza. I have to say that 540 is a great bang for the buck. The crowd seemed like definite regulars who are there a lot. It was a good time and getting PBR in a mason jar for $2 is a steal. Next time I'm in the Richmond I'll be back.
author: J. S.

description:
This is the grossest place on the block! When they first re-opened as the 540 Club I wanted to check it out. Came down on a Friday night with my brother and a friend and we had the worst time ever. 
Really clueless bartender, awful, awful jukebox, rude patrons.

If you walk by this place in the middle of the day you can see all the neighborhood drunks about to pass out on the patio.  In the evenings the ratio of normal people to really fucking weird, creepy, revolting people is about 1 normal person out of 10.
I know one person I like who hangs out here sometimes, and it's for the WiFi and nothing else.
Ew. Just thinking about the 540 Club makes me want to cringe and take a shower.
author: Rachel M.

description:
When I get my fix at Sofia's, I come to 540 Club. The drinks are cheap, the art on the walls isn't half bad, and they're always showing a movie that no one recognizes except Pam. 

While having drinks with a few friends at 540, I went to the nearby corner store to grab a pack of cigarettes. Then suddenly, I saw a glimmer of light coming up over the horizon. Loud screaming and yelling. The light is moving. The music is getting louder.

Am I having a near death experience?

Oh wait, it's a drunk trolley. OMG. DRUNK TROLLEY. 

The drunk trolley (occupied by Ed M and friends) descended on 540 Club like a swarm of locusts on a field of wheat. Suddenly, 540 was PACKED. Oh so many drinks, oh so many people. Then they suddenly left. Everything was back to normal at 540 Club. 

I needed a cigarette.
author: Patrick L.

description:
This is the best place on earth. I love the boys and girls who work there.  
Sunday is trivia night, and Brad does the best trivia in the city. It's challenging but not impossible. 
Monday's are dollar drinks from 10-midnight. 
Tuesday is $2 cocktails. 
There are DJs a couple nights a week. 
First Sunday of the month is a free punk rock BBQ from 3-6p. 
$2 Pabst all day every day, a huge beer selection. 
REAL Absinthe, poured properly. 
They sell more Chartreuse than anyplace in the world. (check the website if you don't believe me! The owner of Chartreuse has come to the bar more than a few times.) 
It's dog friendly before 9pm, providing your dog is friendly too! There are tiny dogs and giant dogs of all shapes and breeds that come through there. 

The end of March is Catholic School Karaoke, end of June is Senior Prom, there's a halloween party, New Years party, etc. Any excuse is a good one to throw a big party!

The bartenders are awesome, so cut them some slack if it's busy. If you're nice, polite and understanding, they'll be nice back. But if you're a douche, then expect them to treat you as one and you won't get the pleasure of getting to know them and possibly making a new friend.

and no, I don't work there or sleep with someone who does, they're my neighbors, so it's likely you'll find me there almost any nite of the week.... and sometimes the day too.
author: Joy T.

description:
I came here with some co-workers for an after work drink today. 
Smelly, dark bar, stinky and icky unisex bathroom. No where to hang your purse, do you really want to put it on a dirty, stanky floor?  It smelled like rotting fruits and vegetables near the bathroom. Gag. 

Luckily they have an outside section which is a plus; however, the chairs outside are missing some bars across the seat and it makes it difficult to sit on them. 

My vodka tonic was good. The bartender was nice. 


Eh. Overall, not too impressed.
author: Amy J.

description:
Bartenders learn your name after two drinks, buy you shots after five.

You curious about Chartreuse? I asked about it, and after a 30-second spiel, was offered a shot.

The Hoegarden here goes down like lemonade. Best Bloody Marys in town on Sundays. They give you free food once a month. 

And it's cultish: the bartenders all have pink elephant tattoos, which they will show you if you ask. Or even if you don't.

The only time this place sucks is when it's too crowded. So why the fuck did I write this? Shit. 540 sucks! Go away?
author: Chris R.

description:
All of my friends love this place and I cannot understand for the life of me why. The layout makes it seem kind of crowded even if there aren't a lot of people and even when it's slow it takes me forever to get a drink. That's a cardinal sin people, I should not be sobering up in your bar.

The drinks are decent and the prices the same. If I could actually get one in a timely fashion (or before the two other guys who got there after me) I might like this place, but for now I feel it's a waste of my time. Maybe it's because I only go on weekends.
author: Keith M.

description:
I had a previous review, but I'm starting a new after last night.

I've been here twice, once for my first DYL, and again after DYL last night. Overall, I think this is a good bar, with quality staff, a decent selection of beer on tap, and a welcoming vibe. 

The first time I was here, there was some very incongruous art on the wall, but there was no art last night. Evidently they change it fairly often. Good.

However last night I got to experience the awesomeness of sitting in the patio while a drunk man came up and apologized to one of my friends. He then serenaded us with Auld Lang Syne and provided some genuine good times. Here's to you, Zheng! I hope you got home safely.
author: neil c.

description:
A friend of mine told me he was renting studio space again which is great.  He hasn't painted in ages and I am excited that I will finally get the piece he has been promising for years.  Unfortunately, he told me I was getting 3 8 foot tall paintings of genitalia.  As much as it made me laugh picturing my apartment with what I am sure wouldn't be Georgia O'Keefe like pretty vages, dongs and a combination thereof, I think it might scare some people off so I think I'll pass.

This discussion occurred in 540 Club which was all decked out in balloons and streamers for reasons we never found out.  We thought it was a frat thing because of the Greek letters on one area but when we paid attention, we noticed that one of them was ZEX.  I don't think that's real.

The bartender was cool, there are a lot of seats and they have Leffe and Hoegarden on tap.  I also heard they have a fun trivia night on Sundays.  I'm in.
author: Seong P.

description:
I'm a new fan of the 540 Club.  A tattoo artist friend of mine has been telling me to check it out...he's had a couple of  'pin-up' style art shows here that have completely sold out.  The current show is pleasing: a bunch of hot rod type red & black stencil pieces on wood.  I talked to them about possibly showing some work towards the end of the year, so we'll see how that goes.

Monday nights get a little packed between 10-12 because of dollar drinks...(or some insanely cheap bar specials)...I'm a little hazy on the details.  I'm sure this is due to one too many Stellas and a banana flavored shot that the bartender concocted for me.  

Overall, I like it here.  Everyone is really nice, it's comfortable, a little dirty (which suits me) and right next to Green Apple Books.
author: Alice S.

description:
When I am out in the Richmond, and I'm chilling, on my own time, it's almost guaranteed that I'm going to try and eat at Burma Super Star.  And when they tell me it's 45 minutes to get a table, it's all cool, because you can get a shot or two at the 540 and then your phone will buzz in your pocket, and your head will buzz with delight because now you're a little drunk, still just as hungry, and here comes the tea leaf salad...

A nice bar with friendly bartenders and bearable music and atmosphere.  My kind of place.
author: Ben V.

description:
It's like the start to an HBO mini-series:
Jew Sister (nickname: Lumberjack) and Jew Brother (me) walk into the 540.  Looking at them you can tell they've come here many times before.  Even in freezing rainy weather they will still sit outside, drink way too much, and smoke too much.  On any given visit there can be one or all of the following: crying, cursing, yelling, laughing, hitting, spitting, hugging, staring, just to name a few.  
But what would you expect from a brother/sister duo where one of the party has a nickname of Lumberjack?  And where else would you expect them to be but at the 540?  Two regular folks with a slight drinking problem, a definite nicotine problem, and an even bigger problem of making fun of everything and everybody that walks by.  Livers and lungs be damned!  The jew-o duo just don't give a fuck...especially when they hang out together.  You've been warned...
author: Zev K.

description:
Here's a little bar that I wish I lived closer to.

540 is a great spot where the specials are cheap and the pours are heavy. Have a few cocktails here and you'll forget what day it is. Woop!
The bartenders always have been nice folks who check up on you when you're sitting at the bar for a while. I'm pretty sure they had a special on Tuesday nights where martinis were like 2 bucks or maybe I was so drunk I imagined that. 

There's a small DJ space where they have some folks spin as well as wacky things like karaoke contests and theme party nights such as "school girl outfit" etc. 

It's the kinda place that it's not surprising for someone's dog to come up and say hi for some pets from you at the bar. For such a small space there's usually a lot going on. All around great locals spot.
author: Andy A.

description:
The bar is dark, dank, and the drinks are strong. Oh yes, the drinks are strong. Had to have the designated driver pull over twice on the way home so I could puke in random parking lots. I think one of them was a bank. 

I'm sure I must have used the bathroom at some point, but I can't really remember. I think I pulled a muscle making sure no part of my body touched the toilet seat. Yup, it's coming back to me now, that's exactly what happened.

One of the regulars had a big cute dog in the bar that was friendly with everyone. It kind of gave a nice vibe to the place. I recommend if you're looking for a place to drink without pretention.
author: Alison C.

description:
If one of my friends never asked me to meet her here, I would NEVER have gone at all, BUT...I have another friend who lives within walking distance and because of this, I've stopped by another time or two.  It's pretty mellow, you can have a conversation and actually hear each other.  The bartenders are SUPER friendly, they usually have some off the beaten path 80's tunes playing (when I've gone), and the drinks are strong and cheap, just like I like my men...I mean drinks...hehe (for the record, I like my men strong and GENEROUS!)

It's actually a decent little spot.  Who knew?
author: Jennifer H.

description:
The 540 club has an intriguing appeal for me. It is the essence of "ying and yang." Everytime I walk through the front door, I'm confronted with an overpowering smell of sweaty feet mixed with hot air, yet they have a cool patio that you can smoke on. Of the three years that I've been patronizing this bar (off and on, of course), there always seems to be something wrong with the floor - like they were going to get it repaired, but then just said screw it! Yet, they feature different types of art work, that is usually really cool, and resonably priced. They usually feature some type of DJ music on the weekends - it's more like an "open-mike set" rather than a professional DJ session, but then again, I've never had to pay a cover. 

Good things often come in strange packages, and that's the best way I can describe the 540 club. Perhaps, you will have a different take on this joint...
author: Michael H.

description:
I work with a guy (glasses, a beard, & a Giants baseball cap - look for him as if he were Waldo) who frequents (by 'frequents' I mean 'practically lives at') the 540 Club. 

He wanted to celebrate his birthday at the bar, so I went to meet him & some friends there. Before he arrived, however, I was accosted and cornered for 2 hours by another co-worker who attempted to extract from me, earnestly it seems, the truth behind the grand conspiracy involving the CIA, our current president, and the Pacific Ocean. Apparently, it was obvious to this co-worker that I had been indoctrinated while he was not. He simply wanted information.

The two hours spent nervously clutching my glass of Stella & standing as a symbol for all that is wrong with late capitalism & imperial aggression qualify as some of the tensest, longest hours of my life & could have, for a lesser man perhaps (or one not privy to the Grand Conspiracy) (or merely one less enamored of the Drink), deterred one from ever returning to the 540 Club.

But I soldier on stoically, demanding no attention, just a lot of alcohol.

p.s. - I once watched a morbidly-obese old man smash his cane through the front window of 540. I would habit the bar simply for the chance to see something like that again.
author: Stephen S.

description:
I've come to finally realize that I actually like dive bars.... my mom would be so proud!

Anyway, this is a cool bar, and they make a good Pineapple Malibu which is currently my drink of choice by which I measure the quality of every bar in the city.  If you leave a comment calling me prissy or girly, I will beat your A$$.  Yes I know I'm supposed to get beer at a dive bar, and I'm sure that's good here too, but isn't beer good everywhere??  Pineapple Malibu is hit-or-miss, and a great bartender can make it taste like no alcohol has been added, and yet you are buzzed from just one.  Or maybe that's just me.

The atmosphere here is nice and open, even though it is grungy and divey.  At least it's not cramped/ sweaty/ smelly/ all of the above.  Some very good dart players were having a dart league tournament in the back, and all the random guys watching were really friendly and talkative.  I made friends in 2 minutes flat.  From what I've read in other reviews of 540, it seems that the crowd as well as the bartenders are very friendly.  It's a good place to bring a large crowd because there's plenty of space, and everyone's chill.
author: Laura W.

description:
This is my favorite bar in the entire world. 

This was the alcohol-serving-establishment closest to my home for two years; This was where I went to celebrate my birthday and where I went to comiserate with friends when we didn't get into the sold-out Mountain Goats concert. 

I've drunk here at 2pm on Sunday in the rain and 1am on Saturday in the fog, and probably most times and temps in-between. I'm happy here alone (they have wireless net!) or with friends, or with a slew of strangers and Suicide Girls (hello, dear Catholic School Karaoke party.) 

I can think of no greater compliment to Richie, Brooksley, and especially Jamie than to pass along that every time I bring a new friend here, said person says "You know, I've always wanted to open a bar."
author: Trisha W.

description:
($2 pints of PBR on Monday night) + (Home being two blocks away)

= AA meetings on Tuesday morning.

*Repeat weekly
author: Eric B.

description:
Whee!  My old man jason had the opening night of his art show here! 
but, yes, meh, i've experienced better times at this bar.  i miss brookes and erin and richie.  the new tenders seem stressed out. or snotty?
eh, ill update again.  i still love them.  you know i love you jaime.  the drinks are good, the crowd is local and comfy.  the music is fun.
author: yayoi s.

description:
When you find a great bar, you know it.  This is one of them.  I actually had my 30th birthday party there, which should give some level of my commitment.  and it was great, so much fun.  

friendly staff, good music, no pretention, good times.
author: Amanda P.

description:
I recently went here for the first time and totally dug this place. Love the decor, the tattoo-inspired artwork on the walls and the beer selection. You also gotta love a bar where the DJ is spinning punk music!

Definitely a place I'll check out again next time I'm in the inner Richmond...
author: Art D.

description:
I hate to do this, but this bar suuuucks. It is another dirty San Francisco bar with no character. Well, 'no character' is not fair. It's an annoying character from a culturally irrelevant movie, like one of those guys who wears a fedora and calls everyone "Daddy". If I'm going to go to a neighborhood bar where the bathroom smells like vomit, I'll go to Trad'r Sam's. 
However, 540 does have dollar drink night on Mondays and a very cute bartender.   : (
author: Caitlin P.

description:
Really chill place.  It's not cramped but I hesitated to go to the 540 club because it always looked crowded.

The Jukebox takes credit cards but the BAR doesn't?  wtfuck?
author: Patrick A.

description:
Good solid bar.

The crowd can vary and sometimes I'll go in and want to leave but most of the time its a good variety of all kinds of people. A good selection of beer and the prices are pretty good. 

The best thing I can say about this place it has none of the sleeze factor that many other bars suffer from. Its generally just a bunch of people going to have drinks and hang out.
author: Patrick B.

description:
Here are the rules of the Clement Street Drinking Game
Take a drink when
1) Someone stops for no reason
2) Someone honks for no reason
3) Someone makes a six point turn. 

Great Place
author: Marcus R.

description: Typical hole in the wall. Inexpensive pints, cash only. And a pool table in the back. The music is loud so don't expect a quiet conversation. I'm not really sure what else to say. We went on a Saturday and nothing special was going on. They also have outdoor seating.
author: Andrew Y.

description:
Ducked in here after I missed my 44 O' Shaunessy. I have 15 minutes to kill, why not have a brew. Ashley the tender of the bar was very welcoming. Whoops! Missed the next 44 bus, ducked in here again!

I happened to walk in here while they were having a "make your own xmas ornament" for the humongous tree in the corner - good yuletide times. Inside the decor consists of dayglo rock posters, and plenty of doom metal on the juke, if that's your thang.
author: wayne s.

description:
Dear Yelp,

Rita C. loves 540.  I think it's okay.

I give 540 Club a fantastic score of 3 out of 5 stars.

Love,
James
author: Cheryll M.

description:
OKay my friends and I have had crazy summer nights here at 540.  Monday night is amazing and will be EXTREMELY crowded due to.......DOLLAR WELL DRINKS! Yea that's right $1 well drinks.  It's great but like Cinderella it only lasts until 12am so if you make it in before then, buy 10 drinks and your night is over. 

Anyways I rang in my 21st here with my bff's.  I don't really have the patience to deal with all the crowds on Monday's nor the large crowds of fellow USF heads that frequent the bar but local San Franciscans like me and my friends hang out there some nights.
author: Crista Y.

description:
I really liked this place, lots.  

Really loud punk rock music playing.  Sweet art on the walls.  Neat crowd of people.  Beers...word.  The service was a little slow, but once they helped us they were totally nice and helpful.
author: desiree n.

description:
I've been coming here for years.  I'm about to go there right now.

I come here to:

- drink excellent beer and liquor served by great people to great people
- play "The Card Cheat" by the Clash on their gigantic kiosk juke box thingie
- drink a shot of afternoon tequila before blowing my lunch money on used books
- read one of those books from around the corner and eat some of that tasty thai food from around the other corner whilst drinking aforementioned beer and/or liquor
- remind myself how smart I'm not, during Smartypants Smackdown trivia (the one and only bar trivia I care to know of), running every Sunday night at 9pm
author: Graham W.

description:
If you find yourself wanting to go to 540 Club or just wanting to go out on a Monday night you should check this place out.

One drunken pre-summer late spring night after going to $1beers (which has now been moved to $2.50) at Park Chalet we were told by a drunken guy that 540 Club has $1 mixed drinks from 10-12pm.

WHAT!? How did I not know about this before after all it is only 3 blocks from my boyfriend's house who at the time I am living with.

The cups are not huge, you know those cups they give you at the doctors for you to pee in? Think that size but hey for a dollar I'm happy to get a shot of anything.

This provided me with an amazing summer of 
Park Chalet $1 beers from 6-9 and then 
540 Club $1 drinks
and also gave me plenty of well worth hangovers.

it would have been 5 stars but when bars hold $1 drink nights they tend to get crowded.
author: Amanda M.

description:
Made a stop here last night with some friends from san jose as we decided to try out some of the bars along clement.

Out of the bars we went to in the night, I enjoyed the vibe in this one the most. Crowd was pretty chill, bartenders looked like they were having a good time, and the music was fun. Awesome 80's and early 90's. And by that, I mean The Outfield and MC Hammer's 2 legit 2 quit.

Definitely down to hit this place up again.
author: Joel J.

description:
I'm giving this bar 5 stars based on several good reasons. 
1) $2 Pabst Pints
2) outdoor drinking until 12 
3) Richie Rich is a great bartender
4) It gets me out of my usual spots...wait this is a usual spot
5) cheap drink nights on Monday and Tuesday
6) friendly and good looking people...imagine that! What a combo!
author: Sarah S.

description:
#1 reason to go=$2 PBR!

The bar has a funny, musty smell so get a table and sit as far away from the bathroom as you can!
author: Celeste M.

description:
One of the few places I can get a bottle of Delirium and watch two dogs fight besides my house. Also, the bar staff are very knowledgeable about birds. So if you ever need to know about eagles, just ask around...

Seriously though, the best Quiz night in town, yeah yeah yeah, i've been to a lot. This one is great.
author: Erik U.

description:
This one of my favorite bars for a few reasons. Mostly though, it's because it's an adaptive reuse of an old building, which is, as you may know, my raison d'etre. It has by far the best ceiling of any bar in San Francisco, possibly the world.

Also, the Sunday night trivia is the best bar trivia in town.

And there's always some extremely fresh dogs running around in there. Dogs are cute and fun, and any bar that lets them roam free is my kind of place. Even if I do need to bring a Zyrtec. But you know, it's worth it.

Decent prices. 

(PS.  Is it me, or does everyone in here already know each other?)
author: Megan W.

description:
One evening several months ago, my friends had a long, drunken stumble (a.k.a. bar hop) down Clement Street. The 540 Club was one of the places we stopped, but the experience in my mind was a little hazy. 

Cut to a recent evening with my friends trying to convince me to come to the 540 Club again. As I attempted to remember the night a few months ago, I was confronted with an overwhelming feeling of dislike -- my memory was that the bar was filled with pretentious people, rude bouncers and over priced drinks. I refused to go and would only be lured out my house by the promise of free drinks.

It turns out I was totally wrong about the 540 Club and was actually confusing it with the Rockit Room (which I really dislike). The drinks here are cheap, bartenders friendly, music good (it was jazz and standards last time I went, but more rock the time before), and the door guy kept calling me darlin'. My only complaint was that I couldn't bring my drink out onto the porch. I'm so glad a gave this bar another chance because now it's one of my favorite places to go in the Richmond area.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
Went for a couple drinks with a friend late evening on a Friday night.  

Crowd was diverse and fun, bouncer was chill, and the ladies behind the bar were very sweet.  Had a surprising variety of beers on tap for a "dive bar".  We had beer and whiskey.  I think it was a TAD pricey but hey perhaps that's just San Francisco.

It got pretty busy after an hour.  Average age to the crowd got a lot younger and a bit more wild.  Figured it was time to hit the road but I'll definitely be back.
author: Tim S.

description:
Is a guy who takes me on a first date to the 540 at monday night for their 1.50$ happy hour well drinks, a winner or a loser? Its hard to say, but it seems so be written all over my face that id be down to get shitfaced and they probably cant afford to take me to anywhere else, so fair enough. 
Strong drinks, nice staff, cool chill vibe and the pink elephants everywhere, at one point i went there and ended up in the morning with a cool hat on thats wasnt mine, cant complain.  :)
author: melissa c.

description:
Good beer selection-Check
smoking area-check
do-able bathrooms-check
great music, dj/juke box-check
service-check..well sometimes its interesting but overall good

what else does one expect from a bar? all you that want more. go to your fancy shmancy clubs and pay 15$ fora  drink. find me at the 540. ps. they have absinthe and chartusse...(dude try a shot! OMG). I am a tequila kid hands down, thats my shot or drink of choice. I play with Jagger here and there but have a shot of chartusse (spl?) it taste like ...shit but has a great after bite and gets to the point! According to the bar tender, they are the # 1 seller of it here in cali or something!

oh its 1$ you call it wells till midnight on monday 
( ; 
viva 540 club
author: Gen O.

description:
I love this place, its the best bar in the neighborhood.
Nevermind that its stumbling distance from my house, or good food, or the bus, or crazy cab drivers - the beer selection is awesome.
You can get $2 PBR all the way up to $30 bottles of superior Belgian ales. The jukebox has a good mix and you can download songs into it, they have wireless internet, theme nights, hillarious trivia on Sundays, and great art on the walls.

I go there at least once a week.
author: Tom S.

description:
I don't know how you can beat $1 drinks (Monday Nights).  That's like... almost free?  $1 drinks also brings in the young, college, below 30 crowd.  Just my type.  The bar also attracts people from diverse backgrounds, as it's located in the Inner Richmond area.  

In times like these, everybody has a tight wallet... but you don't have to worry about that here!

Hard to feel out of place here.  Bring a friend or two... it gets really crowded but that's part of the appeal.  Oyeah the drinks are obviously a bit on the light side (But what do you expect for ONE DOLLAR!!!).
author: M K.

description: Woooooo. $1 Wells on Monday. Great when you're there. Not great when you are over the toilet Tuesday morning trying to hold your own hair.
author: Melissa T.

description:
This was one weird experience...

Not my typical crowd, not even close...place was filled with many mid to late 20 somethings sprinkled in with a few 30+ers...this is that rock/alternative listening crowed...that "drink on a workday" crowd...yet...i felt so at home...

Maybe it was the perfect lighting...maybe it was the chill and laid back atmosphere...

Biggest flaw??  I honestly disliked my bartender...I guess it was just a busy and long day, but he treated me kinda poorly in my opinion...although..he did hook me up on my last round of drinks...I got a beer, a dirty martini, and a screwdriver for $10...pretty darn cool

eh, prolly will never be back here again unless someone else suggested it...
author: Mike V.

description:
Update:
This ups my rating from 3 to 4 fours stars. Sundays is when they provide free BBQ and $2 PBR, in the style of a good old house grill party. There was even a family dog running about, waiting for something to drop off a plate. It will be raining, and they'll still have the grill out front on Sundays. What community cheer and goodwill that was had by all in the joint. Definitely brings all the boys and girls to the yard. I highly recommend going for this weekly treat. The food is really good considering that it's free. And the sides are hearty. All you can eat!
____________________

It's one of the only places to go to because the neighborhood gets really dead by a certain time. Has an outside seating thing, but it's small and usually all taken up by the time you get there. Inside it's dark, and has a smell. The crowd is eclectic, a mix of college kids and very old barflies, dressed down, and laid back. Not a pickup bar, but a friend bar. You can engage and be engaged in random convos with the strangers sitting next to you, or bring friends for decent beer and yelling over the jukebox. In other words, friendly crowd all around... especially at Trivia Night.
author: Clar L.

description:
Overrated.  I've been to this bar six or so times at various times and dates and have never been impressed.  I don't get what people like about this place.  Internet Jukebox?  Boo.  Darts? Boo (go to any of the bars around her that actually have the guts to admit they're pub)  
It's a dude bar and if I want a dude bar I want an old man bar not a bar with a bunch of milquetoast guys.  Also, had a shot of the well whiskey and Jameson and my friend and I both agreed that they both tasted watered down.  Why do people like this place so much?  Why?
author: Ed B.

description:
I have used a 'ish load of "internet jukeboxes" through-out the bay area and by far this certain one is #1,
The place does smell right when you walk through the doors. It's a effn dive bar. It's wasn't a piss smell, but the smell for me when away within the first 5 minutes anyways. It must have been all the pretty girls perfume that night because in no way have I ever been in this place where it's been a sausage fest.

I have met a few of the bartenders and as young as the owner is he is still a great business man and knows how and what works to make that bar run like clock work. Their general mgr Brooks, is by far the best bartender I have ever had serve me drinks whether by the taste,stifness,speed, all with a smile and if you go their a lot she even starts to remember what you start out with. For me 2 absolut screwdrivers, please

A lot of people are happy about the outside front/patio smoking area and I'm happy for them as long as they keep the front doors closed.
A lot of people also like the dart boards too. I like the projector they have with the huge screen that they play sports and  a whole bunch of cool movies in the past.

I gotta say the art here can be hit or miss for me, but to each his own. I have dabbled a little in the mens bathroom giving my own .02cents
Shhhhh.
If you have never been here before be ready to enjoy some great beers  on tap such as PBR, Stella, Chimay, and Hoegarden and 
they also have chartreuse which you can never go wrong with

This bar is MEGA.
author: Andrew Z.

description:
One of my favorite bars in the Bay Area, I wish I could make it out there more.

A small bar, with a great setting, with just about every alcohol you could think up, and always great bar tenders. Sometimes you'll catch a live DJ night, or a night where they're playing some burlesque on a screen above you in the bar, and they also have a great juke box that is always playing some awesome music.

Plenty of room to sit, or stand if you want. They even have a nice little patio area out front to sit, and if you do, smoke.
author: Mace M.

description:
Great music. 
Good crowd.
$1 well drinks on Mondays.
author: Linda N.

description:
I'm the kinda girl who likes to be able to sit down and hang ot with some friends while she enjoys some drinks.  This place is totally rad for doing that.
Sometimes it gets a little crowded but there is a small patio infornt to escape and smoke in.
They have a trivia night for those who love those.
They constantly chnage the art on the walls and at Christmas have a HUGE christmas tree you can put ornaments on!
They have a night were you can bring records in to listen to!
Usually the music is great.
Its CHEAP. hell yeah $2 PABST all the time!
Sometimes, one of the cute bartenders will swing dance with some people. ADORABLE
Monday's = $1 well drinks 10pm-12am. Get there early if you want to sit... it can get PACKED!
And Thursday nights they have DJs. Come first Thursday of each month if you're a Rancid/Lars Frederickson fan....  Its a $2-$5 cover but they give u a free drink ticket.
author: Arika E.

description: Swung by here early last night for a few beers with a buddy and ended up liking the place quite a bit.  It's a bar that isn't trying to be anything other than a bar which I always love.  The drinks were cheap, the bartender was cool, and the place had a nice grungy vibe to it.  My buddy tells me that once it gets later the place gets too packed, but for drinks around 6pm on a weeknight, it was just a cool neighborhood bar.  Only negatives are the fact that they have one of those damned souless internet jukeboxes, and apparently they let DJ's infest the place from time to time.  In the words of the Rev. Horton Heat "A DJ, a DJ, let's get out of here.  I know a place with a little more atmosphere."
author: Joshua W.

description:
Been there over a year ago and actually liked it. the people were great and the bar tenders where nice. i like the atmosphere its darker and narrow. 

But i had a problem with them last weekend. my friends and i tried to get in last weekend, one of my girl friends is 22 years old and her wallet was recently stolen or something, she only had her passport and they would not let her in.. Last time i checked you can fly to different countries with passports, and not just ID's... it's kinda strange how more important a passport is in our country to do things with, yet we can get into a local bar.
author: Ashley M.

description:
Meh, cant beat the price on dollar well drinks on mondays. Although i must admit they gave me a bigger head ache then a buzz. 

Cool paintings, people are low key and down to earth. Id suggest it at least once if you live near there.
author: Michael N.

description:
Diane, I walked in the door and this sound hit me, slow, mysterious and sultry, i did a double take and yes, it was Freshly Squeezed by Angelo Badalamenti, I thought did i just wander into the Bookhouse? I looked around to make sure, but alas no Laura no Audrey. There were several very beautiful young ladies slowly twirling to the music though. I asked for a cup of coffee, blacker than midnite on a moonless night, the bartender chuckled and said no coffee, so I snapped out of my reverie and ordered a Capt and Coke. The pour was strong and as the bartender took my cash he said the owls are not what they seem. hmm further investigation is required...

I've been here several times over the last few years, normally its packed to  the bursting point but on a misty saturday evening, there was room to move around, excellent, As an artist co-op they have a rotating selection of lowbrow art available for purchase, this time was Rock Posters, I didn't get a close look at whom the artist was but they were all great, several of which would look at home in my office Diane. The sound of music filled the air and i kept looking around for a man from another place, you remember Diane, he wore a red suit, anyways the DJ was playing a great selection of swanky jazz, i'll have to check and see if that is a regular thing, as i would definatly come back for more. 

Diane, it struck me again earlier this morning:  there are two things
that continue to trouble me, and I am speaking now not only as an agent of the Bureau but also as a human being.  What really went on between Marilyn Monroe and the Kennedys, and who really pulled the trigger on JFK?
author: Cooper M.

description:
Despite my love for Toronado, this bar is my all around favorite.  Sure there was no door on the shitter for over a year, but they got one now and it looks great!  Excellent selection of beers, excellent bartenders, and excellent regulars.  One of the bartenders gave my buddy and I twenty bucks over the course of the afternoon to keep the jukebox rolling.  The DJ who comes in on the weekends is pretty cool too.  You can't go wrong here unless you're a snooty dance clubber type.  Dogs welcome too.

The doorman is a giaganticus so for your safety have your ID ready and your attitude in check when approaching the entrance.
author: Matt P.

description: I was told bout this bar by so many people, unfortunately when I showed up with two friends of mine one had a passport from another country (nieghbors of US) and they refused to let her in apparently it's against the law to pass a "goverment issued id" the doorman said it was "too foriegn" and "agaist the law" to accept this form of ID, the damn country she's from is right next to the US, anyways I asked the doorman if I can get a second opinion or speak to a supervisor and he just scooted me away and told me I have to leave, seriously I got really angry but I didn't want no problems, so that pretty much ruin the plans for the night so we just went down the street to Rockit Room who didn't have any problems with passports, so if you have a passport please don't go to this place there horrible with customer service at least the doorman is!!!
author: Juan A.

description:
I love this place. 
I work a block away and come here about once a week. 
I mostly come for the people... and when I say people, I mean the bartenders. They are all really cool.
author: Natalie H.

description:
I have only been on a friday night. If I make it there on a monday for $1.50 night I'm sure you'll hear,see or read about it.

The drinks were, wet cheap and fast. What more can you ask for in the drink department. 
Live DJ on some turn tables spinning a wide range of hits. Plenty of space, not over crowded like some bars in the city. If your a Kansas Jay Hawks fan you will find a friend at this place!

The art work opposite the bar is great with out to many bright colors to screw with your head when you've had to many.

Last but not least, you know the bouncer is good when he has a cane and still gets the job done!  If you haven't been try it and see for yourself.
author: Andrew W.

description:
A wonderful friendly bar in the inner richmond. 
Great beer, small but good wine list, tasty margarita's on the rocks. 
Super friendly crowd. Some people bring in their sweet well behaved dogs too.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
I just moved to the Inner Richmond and I cannot get enough of this bar!

Pros: 
great punk music
cool bar tenders
Sunday night Trivia (the only Sunday night Trivia place that I know in the city and it isn't crazy packed)
Cheap drinks (heavy on the liquor)
Cool Decor
Outdoors drinking and smoking (until midnight)
Pool tables

Cons: 
Can get kinda loud (if that's a problem for you)
Decent seating, but runs out quickly
T.V (which can be a pro for some)

A really fun bar, great for small groups. I highly recommend!
author: Tiffany J.

description:
I've lived on and off near Clement street for many years, and I still can't find a compelling reason to hang out at the 540 Club.  It's got an okay atmosphere at night, but during the day I think of it as the depressing place where the unemployed go to smoke and drink outside.

Update: they have cheap beers (although I have some kind of allergic reaction to their draft beers!) and they let dogs hang out there.  The 540 Club is redeemed.
author: Emma K.

description:
I can't really say much bad about this place. The only negative I can think of is the location, but for some people, that's the 540's saving grace being a local haunt. I live on the other side of the park, so it's pretty easy for me, but everytime I go for a beer, I end up leaving completely obliterated five hours later. 

I don't really hang around here latenight too much anymore, but the staff is golden. All the bartenders are great people, they put on some fun theme nights for the kids and they have a great beer selection.
author: Brandon B.

description:
This is a great little club in an area of the city I don't frequent too often. Great atmosphere, great current art display, great bartenders. Great great great. I would be more eloquent, but I'm kind of hungover and "He Said, She Said" on Lifetime is slightly distracting. I can't believe I'm watching this. I mean, seriously. Kevin Bacon deserves an Oscar for reciting dialogue like this with a straight face. And whatever happened to Elizabeth Perkins' acting career? She's cute, she's got spunk; what happened after 1990?

Minus one star for the ATROCIOUS men's bathroom, which I went into mistakenly (and while sober, I might add). The facilities at 540 Club rank in the Top 10 Most Disgusting Bathrooms I've Been In, easily; and I've traveled extensively in eastern Europe. Beware.
author: Alyssa R.

description:
Any place with Hoegaarden on tap is at least 4 stars in my book. Good beer on tap and they place great music. My favorite place to pass the time before my table is ready at Burma Superstar. 

It's definitely a spot for smokers, with an outdoor front patio. Not my scene, but I know what smokers look for in a city where you can't smoke indoors.
author: Defne A.

description:
It's Sunday. Which means it's 540 day.

I guess I can't really call myself a true regular because I only come once a week and only for trivia -- that is, the "Smartypants Smackdown" -- with my friends. (Hooray for the movie round!) But I love this place.

Good people, nice bartenders, rotating artwork, and no meatmarket Marina types here.  And the internet jukebox... well, actually, those things are intimidating. You mean I can play just about anything? Gosh...

Also -- Do you have a dog? Does your dog like people? The 540 is a dog friendly joint. Though if your dog is tiny, be careful. On more than one occasion, I've seen mini mutts get stepped on by bar patrons who just simply didn't see them. (And, yes, they yelped.)

Now, maybe one day I will actually order one of those $2 PBRs...
author: Tara B.

description:
Cool little neighborhood bar that is a solid chill spot.  Really like their outdoor section as an alternative seating spot.  High Celings give it a non-crowded feel.  And they have HAPPY HOURS!  Very Important in my book.  Another thing I noticed was that they have quite a bit of specialized beers.  

HAPPY HOUR DEETS: M - Fr 4p-7p
$3 Select Beers
$3 Wells
author: Mark W.

description:
Memorable times at 540: 

New Year's 2007
Rita C.'s B-Day Party
$1 drinks during the summer of '06
The Grand Rio
Ummm, and other unmentionable times involving good gin+tonics.
author: Lee M.

description:
540 is perpetually crowded, most especially on weekend nights, with very good reason. It's a Mission bar for the Richmond kids, with none of The Mission douchebag hipster shitiness.

Sometimes you'd rather use the MUNI fare and the time you spent on it on a PBR served right quick instead, you know what I mean?

Their beer selection past Pabst though?  Killer.  La Fin du Monde is excellent.  And if you run in Philo, tell that cat that I said hi.
author: G B.

description:
540 Club is a agreat dive-y neighborhood bar with cheap drinks and a good crowd.  It's a block away from the 38 and the 1...and it's right on Clement so you can take the unreliable 2...so it's easy to get to.

P.S. why are there always animals roaming the place when I go in there?
author: Ryan S.

description:
Well...the crowd at this place is kind of annoying, it's small, it gets crowded as fuck, and most of the time the music sucks.  However...

The staff is pissy (in an endearing way), the digital jukebox has everything from Jay-Z to Leonard Cohen, there's an area out front where one can drink and smoke, and (this is why I give this place five stars) there's the Monday happy hour:  $1 well drinks until midnight.  Fuckin' a.  You guys know the way to my heart.
author: Michael H.

description:
My bartender was adorable, and very attentive!!!  He was so cute I just wanted to tickle him and put him in my pocket for safe keeping!  What a doll!  Now that I've stopping gushing about that sweet little honey of a bartender...

Too bad I was on a first date with a weirdo, cause there were about 10-20 other fine young men I would have rather been kickin' it with... There were so many handsome boys floating around this joint that I almost didn't notice the good music and chill decor...  really comfy.  The door guy was also quite nice and just the right amount of friendly.  I will be back...  ALONE!!!
author: Erica S.

description:
This is the place that I learned about Yelp at. I was talking to some cutie who was explaining who her and her friends were and how they all knew each other. I said that sounds cool! If I could remember her name it would be a lot cooler.

I love the beer and the bartenders here; it's a sweet spot!
author: Kim S.

description: When I first started going here with my husband, it felt a little like the boys club.  But after showing up night after night, the patrons and bartenders warmed to me.  This became my favorite bar in the Richmond, and San Francisco for that matter.  We moved away, but this place will be our first stop when we visit.
author: Hm M.

description: Surprised a friend, who lives in inner richmond, so she said we can go to the 540.  The music was good, mostly 50's rock , rockabilly, some old skool slow jams.  Bartenders were attentive and poured very well.  Tip your bartenders they'll respond!  540 has great atmosphere, I'll be back.
author: Ray P.

description:
I like the art & decor, I like the drinks,  I like the beer selection.  I don't like the location.  

This would be a bar I would go to often, if it wasn't so very far away. As it is, I'm up for it if somebody will drive me there and drive me to somewhere nearer to home after.

The bartenders seem cool, though I haven't really had a chance to meet them.
author: Heidi P.

description:
If you are looking for an awesome dive bar with a great vibe, look no further!  Your search ends here in the Richmond.  My good friend who lives around the corner opened my eyes to this wonderful place.  They hang art on the walls, the bartenders dress how ever they want, there is always an interesting mix of people, and you can meet new people!  
People do come with their groups of friends, alone, or with their significant other, but everyone mixes together well.  Also, if you are single straight person, you can potential meet someone here.  

It is a dive bar, so don't expect beautiful bathrooms with someone there to wash your hands for you, or a place that smells full of perfume.  But what do you expect for cheap drinks?  Go back to the Marina and pay 10 bucks for a tiny drink if you are expecting these things.
author: Sarah M.

description:
I cannot resist scratching my alcoholic itch there in inner rich.  yes you could say the 540 pride lives within me.

Single Complaint
Despite a half-assed drunken renovation of the men's bathroom the thing is atrocious.  Stinks, mystery fluid creeping from the tiles and forget about soap.  

But still I go and drink 2 dollar PBRs and Jameson with cranny wheels for cheap (7+tip).  They've also got this DJ on the 3rd Tuesday of the month who is awesome!  Rooster Sauce or something...
author: Jimmy K.

description: It's my living room. If I'm not in there having a Pabst and a Jameson after a long day of taking it from the Man, something's very wrong.
author: Rodney P.

description:
Lively, great beer selection, good all-around vibe, rotating artwork, friendly bartenders, & awesome tunes. What else could I ask for from an "upscale dive bar"?

Most recently my friends and I ate at Burma Superstar (very good) then as we walked a couple blocks to the 540 we picked up some fake mustaches and strolled into the bar looking peculiar and hilarious.  I gave a fake mustache to the bartender, she wore it and gave us shots on the house!  We drank the shots, made some new friends, and drank some delicious beer. Need I say more?
author: Kevan M.

description: awesome bartender here on saturday night. plenty of seats. funny art on the walls. good drink prices. great music. all in all- i had a great time.
author: Abigail W.

description:
Attending their recent annual prom, I stepped off the bus on Geary to make my way to Clement. A group of guys also got off the bus, all snazzed up for  the festivities, and they took one look at my retrofitted wedding gown, and one said "You look like you're going to prom. Do you have a date?" I sized up the group of guys, 6 or so fellas, and said, "It looks like I have 6 dates!" Nothing like making friends before you even get to the bar!
The 540 is subdued, friendly, and the drinks are cheap. They make extensive use of drapery for special events. If I lived closer, I would go here all the time! More bars need to have theme nights.
author: Netty L.

description:
I've only been here once ... and it was for the $1 drinks on Monday.

Yes $1 drinks, awesome deal ... but they are not generous with their pours. I think I'd pay an extra dollar for the drinks at Madrone.

Decor and art was cool. The jukebox is a nice touch as well.
author: Alex C.

description:
Judas Priest, Thin Lizzy, and UFO in the jukebox.  Fuckin' ay!   

Need I say more?

Oh yeah, nice scotch selection.  And in case you get hungry, there's a great inexpensive dim sum place across the street.

Great place to do some damage to your liver!  WHOOOO!
author: Larry A.

description:
Lets get one thing straight. I am not a lightweight drinker...and neither is my friend. Tell me why we started throwing up all over Clement St after drinking at 540 Club. It was their Monday $1 well drink night. I had TWO drinks...and the rest is history. I know well drinks are not made with the best alcohol...but that was some dirty alcohol. 

The crowd was pretty whatever...wasn't really happening. The bartenders were average. The music was terrible...I had no idea what they were playing. 

It doesn't matter what the prices are here...I won't ever come back.
author: Allan M.

description: Love the music and decor here. My kinda bar! Gotta go back soon...
author: Stephanie F.

description: We were drawn in by the enticing patio and pink elephant over the arch. Everyone looked like they were having so much fun, we couldn't resist the urge to join. On a Saturday afternoon there was nothing but locals scattered around the bar stools. Everyone was stoked to be watching hockey, but the real highlights besides the spotless ladies bathroom? We got a Stella and a Hoegaarden for $7. There aren't many other places in the City with such great deals. If you're ever in the Inner Richmond, I highly recommend adding this to your stops.
author: Julie D.

description: I just dropped in here for the 1st time today.  I was impressed by the beer selection:  Lagunitas Hairy Eyeball, Deschutes Mirror Pond and Mirror Mirror, Moonlight Death & Taxes, plus Iron Springs Casey Jones DIPA and others make this a beer nerd's haven if you don't want to leave the Richmond.  The bartender was very nice and quick with the refills.  They have a pool table too, but the felt is blue.  I think it should be changed to Orange.  GO GIANTS!
author: Daniel K.

description: This is a reply to Catherine in the outter richmond. IF you ever came into the 540 on a night or day other than Monday night at ten you'd realize that we have upper tier booze and we know how to mix a cocktail. Why would we rather sell all of our customers cheaper drinks rather than a Manhattan, Sazerac, or Ol' Fashioned...??? And By Skeezy regulars, NONE of our regulars are there on Monday nights between 10-12am. Because of people like you...I doubt you'll ever read this or come back in and that's okay. Come in on a Saturday night after 10 and I would be happy to "mix" you a cocktail.
author: Craig N.

description: Bouncer is sweet, bartenders are awesome, the vibe is good..what the hell else do ya need?
author: Jenelle L.

description:
i'm not a big drinker, but i let loose and enjoyed the sex on the beach that was served.  We had a few laughs and kicked it till the end.  
Visits: 1
Repeat visit: maybe
so those who want to train me let me know :D  I'm open (not that way, nastay)
author: Strawberry K.

description:
Dollar drinks on Monday 10pm-12pm. You will always see me there drinking. If I am not, please notify the police, then the bartender. 

Last time I was there I witnessed a urinal blowing up. The most attractive  female nerd ever, and my inhibitions leaving an hour and a half before I did, and me smashing my face in a womans breasts. 

I recommend this place to everyone. Watch your head when the USFuckeads wanna play darts, the shit breaks skin.
author: F B.

description:
Good beer selection, Belgians, Micro's, etc. Decent tap selection, wish there were more, but, Belgians aren't supposed to be on tap, are they? Wish I lived closer to this bar. I'd be there so often I wouldn't have time or be sober enough to write this. The bartenders are friendly, interesting, beer-knowledgeable and fun. Even the customers are easy-going and I have met many friendly, interesting people here. (Met one guy who was a rock musician on a tour. Told us all about the music business).

If you like a dark, not too clean, definitely not yuppie, place to have a few, or too many beers, (like me) this is your place. Want to smoke? There's an area in the front where you can drink and smoke and watch people walking down Clement. This is a fun bar. A bar to meet interesting people and get smashed. Some people call them "dive" bars, well, that's fine, as long as they're happy going to Harry Dentons or Cosmopolitans and avoid the really cool bars like this one I don't care what they call them.
author: Rich M.

description: Chill, relaxing place for an early drink (6-9pm, yes, even Fridays).  Prices are average, nothing crazy, bartender is very nice and attentive.  The louder crowd usually hangs out on the patio in front, inside is normally pretty tame.  They have a couple tv's, music is normally old-skool hiphop, very chill and still low enough that you can have a conversation with the person next to you.  Unpretentious without being divey.  See a lot of regulars in here.
author: M R.

description:
A pretty good trivia night, the movie round is a nice addition that makes it a little different than everywhere else in the city.  Alas, the last visit was spoiled somewhat by the fact that the person running the quiz had at least two wrong answers that affected quite a number of teams.   Despite that, I am sure my trivia group will be going there again.

Also a pretty good beer selection which is always good in a drinking themed establishment.
author: Alured P.

description:
This place is a bit trendy, but if it's your crowd, it's all good.

Monday's are SWEET.  $1 drinks from 10-12?  Are you kidding me?  It may not always be the best night to go out, but at $1, how can you pass it up?  Never gets too crowded, and on nights other than Mondays, you usually have a lot of space, and plenty of dart boards available.  Everything you'd hope for in a dive bar.
author: Chris M.

description:
The 540 club is one of my favorite places to get a drink in the city. It's the perfect bar/dive for my tastes, and I wish we had one up here in Rosa where I'm living now. The drinks are very fairly priced, compared to other places, and the bartenders are friendly.

The customers are great people too, always willing to spark up a conversation, share food they bring in, etc. One of the last times I was there I had a puppy sitting on the stool to my left, and two guys on the right who brought in steak and potatoes and offered them to my friend I.

Save some cash and come down to this really chill spot, you won't regret it!
author: Aaron P.

description: Since moving into the neighborhood this has become my favorite bar.  It's only a few blocks away and from the beginning I had a magnetic pull toward it.  I don't know if it was the pink elephants that are everywhere from the awning to the tables or it's welcoming front patio, but it drew me and I've been coming back since.  The juke box selection has some real winners, the drinks are pretty cheap (gotta love $2 pabst on tap), and the ambiance is great.  The bartenders and the crowd are always mellow and friendly; somehow I always hang out longer, drink more than I intended, and get to know some cool people.  No complaints.
author: Kasia P.

description:
It started to irk me that i normally never branch out of food reviews, so you are forced to follow this temperament to val-halla along wit' me.

So yeah, as soon as i catch wind of the 1987 poodle revering "it took me a good 3 hours and 68 dollars to make it look like i got in a fight with Crispen Glover in River's Edge" i start to get uber-quesy and overtly-masculine, and that makes me even more bellicose. But then, i see they have the satellite jukebox (where i force everyone to listen to death metal or sonic youth) and some Lagunitas or equivalent spice rack cosmo-hops on the tippity-tap, and then i let it all melt into oblivion while i admire the artwork, swig on fermented "YUMMERS!", giggle loudly observing perturbed hipsters subjecting themselves to the sounds of Morbid Angel and forget that judgemental window shopping really does take a few years off of my life.
author: Christopher J.

description:
I used to live a few blocks from 540. Cheap drinks are always a plus! Nice bartenders? Even better! Being able to grab a quick drink by yourself on your way home without having to worry about the creep factor? YAY!
The patio is nice when it isn't jam packed... I think its usually jam packed though!
Loses two stars because sometimes it smells like diarrhea in there. Sewage problem? I don't know. I am very sensitive when it comes to bad smells!!
author: Jackie O.

description:
540 Club is a great neighborhood bar.  The crowd here is always friendly as are the bartenders.  They have an occassional Sunday barbecue which is a lot of fun.  I enjoy their outdoor seating because I love people-watching on Clement St.

Also, I just discovered their Bloody Marys.  I'm always looking for a good Bloody Mary and if you like 'em spicy, I would highly recommend trying one of 540's.
author: Sara H.

description: Let me say 1st off: I am biased for this bar.  I know a lot of the people who hang out and  most of the staff are my friends.  This place is the best to hang out with your friends for the sake of hanging out.  the bartenders are hot, the service comes with a smile and, for the ladies, it is a safe place to have fun.
author: Luvwulfs B.

description:
(I tend to go to the 540 on weekends and not late at night.  This review may not apply to weeknights after 10:00 p.m.)

What's good and what's bad?

Good:  This bar has a consistent but very diverse cast of regular customers who, if you treat them respectfully, will welcome you and be kind to you.  Same goes for the bartenders.  

Good:  It doesn't matter who you are or what you look like: if you behave in a non-assholish way, you will be welcomed at the 540.  The core clientle and staff are aging punk rockers in their late 20s or 30s.  But there are plenty of diverse others:  older folks from the neighborhood who have been drinking there for years; younger partiers from USF; bookish intellectuals from Green Apple (which is on the same block); sports fans; bike messengers; professionals; etc.  It's quite a mix.  Unusually friendly and accepting.

Bad:  The place is filthy and it stinks -- especially the bathrooms.  I wish Jamie (the owner) would hire a professional crew to clean this place regularly.

Good:  Most Giants/49ers/Raiders games are shown here, but with the sound off.

Bad:  I can't think of anything else.

Good:  $2 pints of Pabst all the time.

Good:  Excellent selection of beers.  Especially high-alcohol beers.  Chimay on tap!

Good:  The bar is dog friendly (at least before 7:00 p.m.)  There are a handful of  dogs who visit regularly and who everyone knows and loves.  The bartenders dispense doggy treats.

Good:  Sells more shots of Chartreuse than any other place in the world.  Honestly, this is true.  A shot of chilled Chartreuse at the 540 is one of the best drinks in the world.  (Be sure to order one for the bartender as a tip . . . .)

Good:  Free barbecue on Sunday afternoons.  It's supposed to start at 3:00 p.m., but that's sketchy.  Figure somewhere between 3:00 and 7:00.  At minimum it will be free hot dogs and hamburgers.  If you're lucky there'll be grilled veggies, or marinated chicken, or gourmet sausages, or even fillet mignon.  Free.  Couple that with $2 pints of Pabst . . . . .

Try the 5:40 during daylight hours on a weekend, and I guarantee that you will like it.
author: John H.

description:
Great place to hang out, especially on Sundays for the Free BBQ from 3-6pm, and later on, Trivia nite with the crew from Smartypants Smackdown. Our team is usally 1st or 2nd (often more the latter) and we are pretty good at winning the team name competition, with clever takes on topics of the week.

Not to mention that visitors may well find yours truly spinning records or doing the BBQ itself.

My BBQ debut was particularly fun. I don't often cook for a large amount of people, so I really wanted to make a good impression. So, instead of the usual burgers 'n' dogs bit, I went whole hog: chicken legs marinated in red wine w/ bbq sauce mixed in, tri-tip marinated in it's own juices w/ herbs 'n' spices, and salmon that was basted with olive oil, lemon and herbs. I whipped up a giant green salad with my special balsamic vinagrette, and added in some chips with freshly-made salsa from a spot I found in the Mission. 

Sorry, but I won't divulge all of my secrets as to the particulars. Don't even try to ask. Sounds pretty tasty, though, right? It was, although a few regulars, and Jamie 540 himself missed out. Too bad.

Another good thing: the 540 was written about in the High Times article mentioned elsewhere in my reviews, particularly for their large consumption of Chartruese. It made an impact on my friend, and he felt compelled to write about it. 

Pretty cool no?
author: ACE A.

description:
I've found myself walking by the 540 from time to time and never had much urge to go in.  Recently, however, some colleagues began to frequent the bar, and I decided to tag along with them one day.  It was a good experience, and I would go back.

Start with the atmosphere.  It's rare you find a place in the inner Richmond that you can sit outside and enjoy a beer.  Of course, it's usually 10 degrees F outside, so that mitigates the benefit somewhat.  The biggest challenge I had were the chairs.  The seats are composed of a set of horizontal bars (from the perspective of looking at the chair).  Nearly every chair had half the bars gone.  Think of sitting on a rope, and you'll understand where I'm coming from.  So a big plus for outdoor seating, but they should go to costco and buy a few new chairs.

The interior was a little dive-y, which I like.  The place used to be a small movie theater, and kept some of the features.  In fact, they were playing a movie when we went - sideways - which isn't the best choice when you have no sound.  In keeping with the star, I would have gone with the Big Lebowski.  Crowd wise, it was an eclectic mix, with some young financial district types intersecting with an alternative crowd I would more often find at the Toronado.  As a heterosexual guy, I wouldn't come here to get lucky, as your choices are limited.  If I was a girl, I wouldn't come here to get lucky, as while you have choices, this isn't really a pick-up scene.

On to the beer.  I ordered a La Chouffe.  Thrilled to see it on tap.  It wasn't cheap, but what do you expect from a beer made by gnomes.  Unfortunately, either it was stale or the line hadn't been cleaned in some time, because it didn't taste good.  We moved on to Leffe, which is an adequate Belgian and making a big marketing push globally.  A fresh keg, just the right temperature and a great alcohol per $ ratio.  Not bad for a mass market beer (usually when I think Belgian I think monk's and cork tops).  They had a few other selections on tap - enough to satisfy most beer drinkers.

Overall, it's a nice bar to have in the Richmond.  I wouldn't drive across town to visit, but if you are close by, it's worth a stop in.
author: Mike C.

description:
The 540 Club is hands-down, my favorite bar in the city!!
