The vibe is cool and the people are friendly. The digi jukebox is always playing something cool, be it the Stooges or the New York Dolls, and I never have to fear being assaulted by some horrible techno or (god forbid) drum & bass nonsense. 

The booze selection is great and there's not a pretentious iota about this joint, which is why I love it. PBR for $2- now that's what I'm talkin' about!! I'll walk out of a place that serves Pabst for $5, they'd probably want to make me drink it with my pinkie extended or only serve it because it's "ironically downscale."  Bartenders at the 540 are cool and would probably do a shot with you (tho you don't deserve it). 

They also seem to have drink specials out the yang, because whenever I simply walk by this place headed to Green Apple, the 540 has a huge chalkboard out front on the sidewalk with killer specials and upcoming events listed. It's a wonder I MAKE it to Green Apple. 

Great smoking patio out front with 5 or 6 tables and room to stand. Never annoyingly crowded (tho they get a large crowd on big holidays), and never so dead you feel like a degenerate just for being in there (and I've been in there at like 2PM on a Tuesday and have a natural proclivity to feel like a degenerate). 

They always have the Giants or Monday Night Football on the TV. Happy hour is always a treat, and you can actually play darts here which is a biggie for me. 

Plus, there's always some wacky crap going on at the 540- they have a boisterous Halloween party every year (this year they showed "Rocky Horror"), and I walked in last Xmas season and they were showing "Silent Night, Deadly Night" on the projection TV! Man, that brightened the holiday.
author: Steve M.

description: 1 dollar mondays! This place gets packed on dollar drink nights so do what I do, order five drinks at a time because it's gonna be awhile before you can order any more. Aside from that this place always has a cool mixed crowd, drinks aren't the strongest in the world but, again, they are only a dollar (on Mondays, only night I go) so you really can't bitch about that. All in all a cool place, come down and have drink with me one of these Monday nights!
author: Tommy P.

description: I've been here many times, this is my goto bar if I'm in the Richmond. It's casual, good drinks, nice people watching, and cute puppies wander around. Oh and I LOVE the photo they have outside of the dog at the beach standing next to pebbles that spell out 540! Haha too cute.
author: Karen T.

description: Yes! $6 for any beer and well shot! Loud music, cheap drinks, pool tables, clean bathroom, nice bartenders. Count me in, baby.
author: Linda Y.

description:
I've only been here during daylight hours.  Mostly, as 540 club is right down the street from Green Apple (and I cannot leave Green Apple without purchasing reading material), it's a good laid-back place to get a beer and look over the new used purchases.  When I've been here, usually in the late afternoon/early evening, I've had no problem nabbing a seat indoors or out, although it's harder to secure outdoor seats when it's nice out.  It's also a really great place to meet up with a friend for a quick beer (Hoegaarden on tap) prior to finding and/or deciding on a nearby eating establishment.  

After reading some of the other reviews though, it seems like I should try this place out at night.
author: Barley W.

description:
though i did have a bad experience the first time i went here, i was completely ignored by the bartender on a somewhat slow night, its not like me not to give second chances, especially when reviewing places.

so fucking omar b calls and wakes me up. short time later, i walk into a bar full of drunk people, from the looks of it, some barely surviving the b2b. it was very interesting to see drunk people while i was sober......this doesnt happen often. 

well that was fun while it lasted, soberity that is.

reason i like 540

can i get four shots of gg chilled in one cup?

you mean a quadruple shot?

(i love you?)

the bartender was awesome. when i was going the wrong way to the bathroom, he went out of his way to say, "other side". see small things like that make a place feel so much more welcoming. 

nice sunny sunday afternoon, enjoying a few drinks, they bbq? nice.
author: Euge L.

description:
this bar has it out for me.  i can't seem to get away from it. no matter who i hang with or what i do, the primordial forces of the great 540 call to me and i must obey.  

apparently, i'm not the only one.  

fact: i just got an urgent call from my drunken friend who climbed his way out of some bushes he had made his home for the night just to make it to the 540.

fact: another friend left me messages about how he walked into a wall and passed out, bleeding, but was awakened by the force and made it to the 540 in time for last call.

coincidence, i think not.
author: Karen K.

description: Friend had been telling me about 1 dollar Mondays for awhile so I finally went the other week. 1 dollar drinks sounded amazing but I knew there was a catch somewhere. Apparently the catch is the people that go there on 1 dollar Mondays. Yes I know I should have been expecting that a bar in the Inner Richmond would be chock full of douchey USF kids but ugh really? Was definitely not impressed nor drunk enough to enjoy the awful music, awful crowd and weird vibe. This place gets two stars because their clientele isn't their fault and cause those dollar drinks were really strong. Probably will never go there again though.
author: Tam G.

description: A DJ in the back played CD's and danced by himself.  Two movie screens showed two movies.  The place was packed with people and dogs.  It all had a good vibe, but I couldn't hear the people next to me.  Sorry, Yelpers, but it was time for me to move to the next party.
author: David D.

description:
I'm surprised that I've never been here before last night.  It's totally the kind of bar scene I like.  Cheap drinks, dark lighting, chill back people, dogs allowed and within close proximity to a guaranteed bedtime buddy.  Add the fabulousness that is the AK and Jill S. booze trainwreck as witnessed by other inebriated Yelpers and you have 540 Club!  I was doing pretty good for being on the 3rd stop on my Thursday night social blowless bender.
I rolled in here looking like a motherfucking Paris Hilton wannabe last night.  Especially since I humiliated my chihuahua and put him in a Juicy Couture bag which I carried into the bar. I am NOT a motherfucking Paris Hilton wannabe but I AM a bit of a whore and I wanted to show some skin so as to make it even easier to get my date in bed.  It's pretty easy anyways but a girl's gotta make a guy feel special, right?  I mean it's not EVERY night that somebody gets to take a slightly tipsy me out to dinner and back for some bedtime wrestling. 
: /
Shut it.  I bet my number is still lower than yours. Bitch.
author: Jill D.

description: I've spent a lot of time here. More specifically, I've spent birthdays, holidays, Saturday mornings and Wednesday 1am's, happy hours, disaster hours, and probably $3000 at this bar. It's not perfect. None of us are. They don't take credit cards, they play a lot of Sugarhill Gang, the booths are so decayed the vinyl can literally draw blood. But I'm sort of an asshole, I order mean drinks like the JonBenet Ramsey and, not so unrecently, I've barfed in the sink here. Like I said, nobody's perfect.
author: Zoe B.

description: Where to go in the Richmond for a drink and to chill?  The 540 of course.  Smack dab in the middle of 'New Chinatown' amidst the dim sum and Chinese grocery stores, the 540 sits and draws in locals (and non-locals) for an afternoon/evening of revel.  The front patio teases you to come on in and join the fun...especially on a warm afternoon.  Once inside, feel free to pull up a chair and feel at home...except you're surrounded by friends.  The crowd is a good mixture of what SF represents...cool people.  The bartenders/staff always seem to be on the ball too...which isn't what you'd typically expect.  It's especially fun when Yelpers make a stop in here.
author: JeFF T.

description: Monday night. You're thinking there isn't much to do, people don't want to go out, might as well stay in. WRONG. $1 well drinks at the 540 Club is the place to be. Super crowded, young, diverse city kids getting their drank on a Monday. Gotta love it.
author: S. M.

description: They reject Canadians!  The bartender refused to serve my lovely, polite roommate after she used her passport and visa as ID then and asked her to leave.  This is after they carded her at the door and let her in.  Mind you, there were only about 15 people inside, so I don't know what the bouncer was for.  The bathroom made me reevaluate my opinion on toilet seat hoverers as it was absolutely disgusting.  And my hair smelled like smoke when I got home.  Then I stayed up for an hour looking up state alcohol identification requirements.  This place not only sucked, it made me made me angry and vindictive!  What a craphole . . .
author: Elena S.

description:
I've been here twice.  Two very different experiences.  Both probably not the average experience at a dive bar in the Richmond, let alone 540 club.

Visit 1 -  Home of what i have come to know as the shortest date ever.  Here's the story, so i make out with this hot guy in a band....cuz he tells me ill get a free CD if i do.  It didn't play out exactly like that and if you were to hear the story from me, its really not as bad and whorey as it sounds...honest.  Now, he doesn't have the CD on him that night, so we set up to meet at 540 club a week later, cuz i did my part, now its his turn, and he wants to see me again anyway....I'm that good.  :)    He walked in a few minutes after me and the bar was empty, so we had the bartenders full attention.  My date spent the majority of the time trying to see if he could get his friends to spin in the back, and possibly rent out the place for a private party.  So i guess that's cool.  That option is there.  DJ's spin?  Private parties?  Sweet.   Drinks were strong, and the bartender even gave us a free one, but seeing as though my date and myself had both had really long weekends and this was a Sunday evening....he walked me to my car after 1.5 hours, kissed me goodbye, and I went on my way.  Home by 9.

Visit 2 - Flash forward many months later....i completely forgot about this bar, and lo and behold the DYL has its last leg there this past Friday.  I got there before the swarm of other Yelpers, Sammy S. bought me a beer, and we watched the party start.  To be honest, at this point i was wasted already, probably didn't need the beer, but  I had a great time anyway.  Bartenders were pretty quick for the mass amounts of people, and the layout was pretty accommodating.  Benches around the bar make for good seating...a patio out front gives the option for smokers to sit and enjoy their drinks....and Yelpers surrounding you give you ample opportunity to say stupid shit, do things you normally wouldn't do, and somehow avoid paying for any drinks.

I would and will most definitely come back here....maybe next year for Catholic School Girl Karaoke?  Maybe for another really short date?  Or maybe just on a normal night so i can experience this bar for what it is supposed to be.
author: Lauren F.

description: I've only been away from the City for less than two weeks but there already some things I am missing...and missing them in the most ridiculous ways. The 540 is one of those places...mostly because I met a guy from the Richmond at the Luxembourg Gardens the other day and we talked about the 540 for at least half an hour. I want a beer....make it cheap and American. Did you know in Paris a beer is 6 Euro? That's like $10. Enough...all I'm saying is that there are little things that are really important to me and most of those can be found at the 540 on most nights. All things cheap and American...most of my friends included.
author: Laura D.

description: As other reviewers have noted, this is a bar, not a club - and my proximity spares me the purgatory of circling blocks for parking. I stopped in here during my tour to familiarize myself with prices and ambience of nearby establishments - I'm not a big drinker, especially of beer, but my companion might be. The bartender and the barflies were friendly. I liked the peculiar art on the wall, although I couldn't afford to buy any. A word of advice, though: the "patio" is the size of a large apartment balcony, so you'd better like your neighbor!
author: Marcus M.

description:
I was ridin' the bitter boat and stumbled here alone after my friend flaked on going to Purple Rain night @ Underground SF last second. I'm a fairly shy and awkward person, so I wasn't quite sure what to do with myself once I got inside 540. I ordered a jack and coke, and before I could even dislodge my wallet from my extremely tight pants, the bartender had it ready. 

It wasn't too crowded, and I had an easy time finding a seat toward the back near the DJ area. (good, old school punk tunes were playin')    I guess I looked either extremely bored/tired/drunk/lonely/confused  'cause the barback  was hanging around the common area and kindly introduced himself and said, "Welcome to 540".  hah, kinda made my night. I'll be back.
author: lex c.

description: I like the 540 if im out in the Richmond. I usually stop in there to see the recent art on the walls, maybe run into a few friends, and say hi to the owner Jaime. Its near the Last Day, so maybe before or after a show. I love that they have darts there, and the drinks are cheap.
author: Rachel L.

description: This place gets four stars because the drinks are very reasonably priced and the atmosphere is comfortable and unpretentious. A good dive. On sundays in the early evening there are free nachos. The jukebox has some good offerings but is over priced/ may steal your money.
author: Leuwam T.

description: Lot's of cute boys lingering about and I really like the red drapes hanging from the ceiling, and I guess it's ok if you live in Inner Richmond.  Maybe I would hang out there if half the bars in San Francisco burned down and the cabs were lined up to take me back to downtown.
author: Amy Z.

description: only cuz of monday nights when the boys r thirsty and buying me $1 drankz
author: Pauline P.

description:
Pluses: Rad bartenders, $2 PBR at ALL times (Fuck "Happy Hour"), Great beer selection (Can you say Belgians on tap?), Monday well drink special rocks, Fantastic Bloody Marys, Rockin music-(not the usual bar standard Tom Petty crap- here's for going to a bar and actually hearing something NEW that I haven't heard before), the Juke Box is excellent, local art on the wall, they have DARTS biotch!!
Minuses: Good luck getting a drink Fri. or Sat. night- it's packed and oftentimes there's only one 'tender at peak times (odd). Also definitely a scene, be prepared to feel as though you stumbled into a geeky hipster house party where everyone is eying you cuz you weren't invited. Art sometimes looks like it was done by your creepy goth roommate who sculpts misshapen penises and bloody vaginas.
Overall: Cool bar.
author: Jonathan M.

description: My favorite spot in the city for $1 drinks on Mondays 10-12. & In general, friendly employees, good vibe. Nice location. Doesn't get too packed unless its Monday!
author: monique D.

description: And to top it off, my friends that were with me that night just walked in tonight, 5 days later, and he is compulsively lieing to customers saying my post calls him a crackhead and to shove tables up his bum.  I gave you a chance,  you failed I hate talking bad about someone but all these incidents rolled up into one person is pretty sickening.  Sorry Buddy.  maybe you were having an off..week..?  Bummer
author: S B.

description:
5 stars for Ben's EPIC BLOODY MARIES!!! 

If you take your bloodies seriously, this is THE BEST place in the city. Fuckin forget Zeitgeist! Ben's got the perfect proportions down and knows what "super spicy" means. Loaded with pickled goods & perfect use of Sriracha!
author: Sarah Anne H.

description: Good Times. Every hood should have a bar like this. Super eclectic mix of patrons is what I like.. It's dark, which is good. the music is surprising relevant. Porch-front smoking. staff appear to be on never-ending benders.. Next time you have the urge to drink warm PBR's in the dirt next to a honey bucket re: Zeitgiest, that craphole, come here instead. Plus I saw someone doing blow off the sink which is awesome. A+.
author: charles p fa t.

description: This has quickly become my new favorite bar. It's dog friendly, has an awesome staff, and friendly patrons. Every time I come by, not only do I make a few new friends, but Casper the wonder pup finds new playmates as well. :)
author: Cat S.

description: Easy to spot, 540 is a no-pressure kind of dive that one can use to meet up with friends if you are eating on Clement.  Very cool bartenders and a low-key setup make the environment easy to just pop in and out of.  No one can care less.  They have a variety of beers on tap, as well as shots of fernet.  Like all dive bars, sometimes it seems like the whole city is here and sometimes you and your honey can comfortably exercise some major PDA and only the bartender will pretend not to notice, if he/she even cares, that is.
author: Dee C.

description: I love the fact that I can walk here and that is close to a few other bars my friends and like to hit up from time to time. The drinks are reasonable and the atmosphere is great. The only negative I have to say is they don't take passports as a form of ID.. my room mate lost hers on one of our many adventures around the city and her passport was all she had... a passport is the most legit form of ID.. come on now!
author: Danielle K.

description:
i had so much fun!!!

what made the rest of my night was the friendly, cool, silly, funny people we encountered here, especially this guy who gave me a sexy, crazy lap dance with kissy faces on the side.

so, saturday was purely amicable brushes with the customers, regular & non-regular. the bartender was also friendly & attentive.

we played darts with some guys, as well.....and it was total fun!

however, the benches are in need of some new cushions, they are quite tattered and the bathroom was a total mess! a worn out velvet curtain is not sufficient enough to have your privacy..and the walls are also in need of new paint to cover the non-sense hen tracks!

overall, this is a fantastic place to lounge!
author: Nelle A.

description: This is a cool looking bar, so I assumed I would enjoy the experience. I also assumed the people would be friendly. Don't assume. Both of the times I came here, something bad happened. First it was Halloween and they were playing Rocky Horror Picture Show (OMG! a personal favorite of mine). Of course we have to sit next to a _____ girl dressed up in a fat girl costume... our table legs were rickety... and down falls my drink - a vodka soda (clear for godsakes) onto her jacket. Well all hell breaks loose I end up receiving the wrath of hell. Total buzz kill on my favorite holiday!! :(  The next time I don't quite remember what happened, but maybe it just seemed boring? I really wish I liked this bar because like I said it looks cool and I mean come on, they play rad movies and good music! I will give it one more try, hence the 3 stars.
author: Sonya D.

description: Great bartenders- cheap drinks- a place to drink and smoke outside!!! count me in.  this place is awesome.  the bartenders remember a friendly face and may even buy you a shot or two.  $1 drinks on monday  means plenty of fun drunks.  darts and a juke box, and djs there on a regular basis makes it an entertaining place.  there aren't enough places like this in the richmond.
author: Shanti G.

description: After The Other Place turned into the Dog's Testicles (sic, Bollix), Max's 540 Club WAS the best dive bar west of Masonic.  They had ping pong in the back, truly $1.50 HighLifes and PBRs, a nice cadre of "regulars", and a bartender that was going to mortuary school and would bring in wax body parts she made in class earlier.  After a temporary stint as some lame imitation of an Irish bar, it is now back to the 540 Club (sans Max's), trying oh-so-hard to be hipster-central-on-Clement.  I want my drunks and fake ears back.  One star because it apparently does not serve Canadians.
author: Aaron F.

description: I'm stoked for football season so I can escape the Mission after the early game and grub out on some BBQ at the 540, those bartenders are awesome! (and not too hard on the eyes either)
author: Colleen B.

description: I don't understand how this bar could get two stars.  okay so its a neighborhood bar, act like one!  The fat ass bar tender on monday nights is worthless.  Dollar drinks are nice if you don't have to wait for 20 minutes with five other people at the bar.  I guess if you are friends with the owner, have huge boobs or know the bar tender you should have a great time.  just don't its not worth it.
author: kyle h.

description: Cool local place in the Richmond with friendly staff and good brewskie. Crowd tends to be Richmond to the core but that's usually a good thing if that is what you are feeling like that particular night. The staff really pays attention and works to get your drink to you as fast as possible. The man at the door is not to be triffled with either so don't f** around. He will eat you in a ham sandwich. You aren't even the main course. He's a nice guy though. Be sure to check out the jukebox and the scrawl in the bathroom about your mom.
author: Sven S.

description: Sorry Troy, but I fucking hate this place.  It is a total shit hole.  It smells overwhelmingly like piss.  I like dives, but this place is gross.  The bartender is cool and for that I will keep this at 2 stars.  Unless you are a glutton for punishment or smell blind, skip.
author: angela k.

description:
funny story: i walk into a bar (ouch). 

all horrible kidding aside, i walked into 540 nine months ago and today i had a 'oh my god i love this place' baby.  great bartenders, challenging trivia, ostensibly awesome owner....

it's my favorite bar in the city.  period.
author: clever u.

description: Easily the best bar on Clement on nights when a DJ is around, arguably so even without. Cheap drinks, awesome bar tenders, too far out for all but the most entrepreneuring USF students to stumble to (aside from dollar drink night), great music, tiny outdoor area for smoking with your booze, all adds up to being awesome.
author: Preston G.

description:
I like dive bars, I really do.  I have been wanting to check this place out for a while.  So, we went after dinner last night.
It was ok.  I like the lighting and loved the huge screen showing Better Off Dead.  The DJ was rockin' the place with great music, as well.
On the downside, the vomit stench was pretty damn strong.  It makes me think back to that smell you'd have to live through in elementary school when a kid would puke in class and they'd cover it with sawdust until the janitor could come.  Then, they'd spray some weird disinfectant that almost smells worse than the vomit.  Together, it's a sickening smell and one that makes everyone want to start barfing all over again (kinda like Chunk's story in Goonies).  Point being, it was a really strong smell and made us want to leave.  And, at the risk of sounding like an old fogey, the music was SOOOOO loud.  It was great music, just too loud to be enjoyable.  Maybe I'm just past the point of wanting to scream to my friends 1 foot away just to have a conversation.
author: Jessica L.

description: This dive bar brings back memories as a college student.   When your on a budget, the $1 well drink special on monday's (vodka-cran, gin & tonic, rum & coke) allow you to get your "drink on" without burning a hole in your pocket.  Definitely something to check out if you live in the area.
author: Clarissa P.

description: No one that I know of actually goes to the 540, you just somehow end up there after you've had a few somewhere else. It is as though the 540 has a magnetism that only beings to pull at you in the first dizzy steps toward tipsy. I've enjoyed myself every time I've been to this Richmond dive (& aren't dives the best bars, anyway?). The bartender, I think her name is Brooks, is always very sweet to my boyfriend and I ---she gives us beers to sample and makes intelligent conversation not typical bimboesque blabber. I like the dark decor of the bar and the art on display above the back tables, they make for a shadowy ambiance that a few drinks intensifies. It's a spot that you will eventually find yourself at anyway, on a Wednesday maybe at 1am, drinking a hefeweizen with lemon and thinking to yourself this is a great bar.
author: Jessica D.

description: Good beer in a cool bar makes for a great way to end a DYL.
author: Ryan L.

description:
as a person who usually travels by myself of with a maximum of 3 other people, visiting this bar the first time was slightly overwhelming as most of the people who frequent it are regulars and know each other. but the service is great, the locals are really friendly, and if you just come by on a sunday afternoon for beer and BBQ- maybe drop by with your dog along a walk- you can always find someone cool to befriend. and if you just drop by once in a while, you become comfortable really quickly. plus, with a digital jukebox, darts, a smoking area in front with tables, cheap drinks, and a really cool staff, this is my favorite bar in the city. the boys bathroom is renovated and cool but they are still in the process of planning what to do with the girls room, so there's that, my only complaint...

so i'm editing this like a year later. i've up'd the rating to 5 stars (from 4), because the girls room is finished. plus, i met my husband here. although i'm probably the only person to hook up and then marry the guy, this place will of course always be "our" place.
author: Susan L.

description: The 540 Club is my favorite neighborhood hang-out.  It is right next to Green Apple bookstore which could make for a chill night -- grab a book and a beer at the bar.  Or you can harrass the staff to give you the Connect Four board game and play until your eyes are seeing red and black dots all night.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
I am a fool for having missed out on this bar for so many years. 

After graduating from USF, I moved downtown and didn't see the west side of Fillmore for almost ten years. Silly me. I have since moved back toward the westerly parts of town and have reacquainted myself with Cole Valley, the Haight, the Sunset and the inner Richmond and have found a bevy of worthy joints I carelessly overlooked in my totally clueless early, early twenties. Among those gems is the 540 Club on the bustling and cool Clement Street. 

I was introduced to it by my beau when we first started dating a couple of years ago and was immediately taken in by its funky, colorful decor, its chill bartenders, good jukebox and great selection of yummy libations. A former bank, it has a high, embossed ceiling giving the narrow space a sense of openness. It has a front smoking porch and dart boards and wooden bar that has been properly chewed up over years of use. There is always a rotating art show on the walls that features work that is interesting at worst and often truly good. They have DJs regularly who play fun, unobtrusive stuff that's good for dancing or for chatting. The bartenders are totally cool, but not too cool, if you know what I mean. They pour strong drinks, have a great selection of craft and imported beers, including a great bottle selection featuring some of the harder-to-find Belgians. 

WARNING: When you go, DO NOT FORGET YOUR I.D.! The doorman is a pit bull about this! You could be 68 and look every year of it, but the doorman will not let you in if you do not have your valid I.D. He will shake your hand, call you by name and still ask you for your I.D. Don't give him shit. He's just doing his job. And as I former bartender, I can tell you how muy importante it is for every single person in the bar to have valid proof of legal age. So, just bring your license and be prepared to show it.
author: Sage R.

description: My friend Eddy, a somewhat small, diminutive asian fellow, invited me and the boyfriend to meet him here for some drinks. I was expecting karaoke and lots of aZns but instead got the pierced and tattooed crowd. This place rocks! The clientele are friendly and not as intimidating as one might think and everyone is obviously there to just have a good time and not grope anybody's ass. One of the great neighborhood bars.
author: Cathy T.

description: Being a former "marina girl" who is now living in the inner richmond, I'd been reluctant to explore the bars in my hood.  i was so excited to find 540 club.  They have chimay on tap, an outdoor patio and I hear they do BBQ's on Sundays!  Cool crowd, awesome local dive bar.  I'll definitly be heading back.
author: kimberly k.

description: Great place, cool bartenders, friendly-ish patrons.  Sunday night Trivia is my favorite.
author: Jason H.

description:
Sheesh, I'm lame. How can I live 2 blocks away and not talk about 540?  Idiot!  Loud drunk people in a loud dark bar in a loud neighborhood on a busy street in a great city.  I'm going for the most prepositional phrases in one sentence in a yelp review on the internet in the US from around the world.

Seriously, low key and chill.
author: Misti L.

description: I love the 540 Club! They have fun parties and the staff has good attitudes. I love the fact that they are open to showing all kinds of artwork too.
author: jamie o.

description: This is the Monday night destination. I've been trying to get more of my friends to come out but they just dont have the balls. Shout out to shea for pouring countless cocktails in a 2 hour span. The only thing missing is a live DJ, especially considering there is some expensive equipment just chilling in the back. I hear sunday bbq is cool, I haven't tried it yet, but overall, give this place a try, at these recession proof prices, you would be a fool not to.
author: Craw H.

description: Come here to grab a $2 pint of Pabst in the Richmond.  The bartenders are nice and chatty.  The small outdoor area gives you a prime view of passerbys on Clement.  I'll be back soon enough.
author: Marsha Z.

description: It's kind of like having a drink in that kid from high school's basement except there's a jukebox and choices beyond Budweiser and Miller Lite and no one has been in high school for at least 10 years.
author: charlotte c.

description: This is a fantastic dive bar. The bartenders are first rate. The patrons are blissfully non-marina (read: a bit unusual in style and most of them actually display manners- dusting off those neglected words "please" and "thank you", etc.). Drinks are great as is the juke box. It is also a showcase for very talented local artists. Oh, and they have a fun (and not to over the top/cliquey/serious) pub quiz on Sunday nights.
author: Mishka L.

description: a lovely dive bar with FREE WIFI...what more can you ask for? dollar drinks, you say...yep..they got those two. Great laid back vibe, excellent art that rotates frequently and good jukebox.  You just can't go wrong here.
author: Dee T.

description:
nate made my old fashioned....its fuckin rocked

cool atmosphere...they got hoegaarden (nice Belgian white) so thats fukin cool too

met a guy from fistfam...we drank some fernet...that was cool too

def a cool bar
author: t m.

description:
I'm a mission dweller. Like most mission dwellers, I tend to not leave the two block radius surrounding my house. Ever. 

Well, I'm glad I did and ended up at the 540 Club in Inner Richmond. Super cool vibe and crowd. Great, friendly bartenders. Awesome selection of beer. Cute outdoor seating area. 

and really, for some reason, I'm a huge fan of the Dumbo decor. 
If I ever leave my neighborhood again, you may just find me here.
author: A K.

description: You made it feel like it was 9 PM inside the bar when it really was 4 PM - I could shoot a "day for night" scene here if i needed to. also drinks are pretty strong and it doubles as a dog show w/a never ending parade of mutts that accompany their masters here.
author: Alexis D.

description:
a poem about the 540 club. 
by me.

(clears throat)

$2 PBR.
i repeat, $2 PBR.
i don't care if a hungry alligator is tending the bar.
$2 PBR.
author: Steve T.

description: Great unexpected find in inner Richmond.  All I gotta say is that with that little hottie behind the bar I wish I were a local!
author: kerry l.

description: Cheap drinks and there was actually room to move around. I really dont know what else you could want in a bar. Besides someone else to buy the cheap drinks
author: Erin F.

description: The bartender (an Asian girl) was really, really cool and nice.  Good service.  This is a total dive bar.  I went with no make up, exercise gear, running shoes, and didn't feel out of place.  One guy brought his cute dog, which brought a smile to my face.  They have a digital jukebox, and we played some Sheryl Crow.  A fun time was had by all.  Oh, and they played Joe Dirt and Swingers on the big screen.  Nice.  They sell bags of chips for $1, too.
author: Sarah F.

description: I generally only go to this bar on Mondays and Tuesdays for their shockingly cheap drinks (10pm til midnight). I don't ever go here on other nights, considering its awkward setup and lack of pleasing atmosphere. It is a really chill dive bar, though. The bartenders are mostly nice and drinks and beers are usually $4, so I'm never against dropping by for a drink and conversation.
author: A. A.

description:
this place is everything i could ever ask for from a bar. a dark and dank, cavernous like ambiance...hoegarden on tap....relatively clean bathrooms (from what i could discern through my booze goggles)...space to sit...decent music selection (read: conducive to drunk sing alongs)...and the perfect amount of noise and no noise to allow my roommate and i to have a platonic love fest without screaming (too loudly) and awkwardly being that conversation that everyone at the bar is listening to.

five stars. i will definitely be back- sometimes i've got to switch it up. sorry, bitter end, i still love you.
author: Rachael S.

description:
since Jenn L. tells it like it is, my experience here is skewed because i knew the bartender here. this particular bartender knows what i like and got me 'eff'ed up. 
GOOD DRINKS - yum, yum, YUM!  the music comes from a juke box? news to me, i was impressed they busted out MIA. 
they only took cash for the drinks so be prepared if you go. we score a sweet spot right in front for the car so i didnt have to stumble far after last call (all you safe responsible drivers can thank ur lucky stars, Jenn L was NOT driving that night). its a bit grimy in the bathrooms, if you can wait till u get home i'd reccommend it. the dart boards amused my friends , sorry we broke one of ur darts 540-club it really was an accident. the people here were friendly and laid-back. i'd definetely return.
author: Jenn L.

description: A good place to go to after eating dinner somewhere on Clement for after-dinner cocktails.  They mix a good martini.
author: Asteridae A.

description: Hands down, my favorite bar in San Francisco. Cheap drink specials on Monday and Tuesday nights, amazing jukebox, a smoking patio, $2 Pabst pints all the time, and always a great crowd.  It's like Cheers for the indie rock crowd!
author: Tim T.

description: I'll give it another chance.  It was (is) Friday and the place was less than half full.  DJ was spinning oldies until my friend made some requests and in 20 minutes it turned into a hip-hop club.  Reasonable drinks abound, art is plentiful on the walls, a small front patio appeals to the smokers, and a booth-like padded bench runs along the whole wall.  It has potential, the 540 does.  Perhaps another night.  Update coming...
author: Eric S.

description: The 540's always rockin'. This is one of my favorite bars, with a rock n' roll but not over-the-top atmosphere, very laid-back crowd, and awesome music. Love it.
author: Patrick G.

description: A dive bar for those who like to wear black, but luckily they are welcoming of others. Super nice bartenders, and they give you pumpkins to carve during Halloween (mine was the square, if anyone saw!). I'm usually picky about weird people in bars, but everyone was nice to us when we went, and not in a creepy way.
author: buttercup r.

description: What a great bar!  Wonderful bartenders, friendly clientele, great drinks that don't break the bank.  I'll be back.
author: Vince G.

description: If I was the type of guy that picked up on women at bars, this is the epitome of where to go. I said IF. That's right a dive bar with friendly women. Take special note of the free bbq on sundays, we're not talking hamburgers and hotdogs either.
author: Rob H.

description: Drunk darts and $1 wells on Mondays/$2 cocktails on Tuesdays = a party in my pants.............pockets.  I'm a broke ass.  If you see me, don't be scurred to say hi! ;) Anyways last time I was there they were playing Napoleon Dynamite on the big screen, while some flamboyant DJ with flailing arms was dancing to the Depeche Mode CDs he was 'spinning'.  Also the rum 'n coke was pretty strong on Monday nite and being that I'm a light weight.. well..I tried to suck it up and be a big girl.  Although the bathrooms are no place for a lady.  Thank God I have friends that just live right around the corner.
author: Joellene B.

description: This is the kind of place where you could come literally every night of the week and have a great experience.  It's everything that a neighborhood bar should be - not too dark but dark enough, not too loud but loud enough, not too busy but busy enough.  Great cheap drinks, and normal to good looking people who aren't being pretentious about the people watching.  There's a great selection of interesting art & photography, as well as a stack of Guardians near the door.  The vibe was seriously awesome - it was a relaxed, happy, "i don't care about your clothes or your job" kind of place.  REAL in a place where it's hard to find reality.  Therefore, I felt perfectly at home :)    Can't wait to have another excuse to hang out here.
author: Becky N.

description:
a great bar with nice decor [a wall of art that changes every week] and a good, young crowd

only real issue is the GHETTO-ass bathroom that doesn't have any closing doors
author: Charles C.

description: It's like a mission bar, but close to home. The art was cool. Can't remember if drink prices were reasonable.
author: Rachel B.

description: A wondeful place to hang out after dinner with acouple of friends. Drinks are cheap, but kinda limited in options. The atmosphere is great and joyful. Bartenders are always smiling and glad to serve.
author: David M.

description:
booze, darts, and a black great dane.

this is one of the top sun-thurs place to go to get a drink. fri/sat i like places a little bit more crazy and crowded.

Oh. And there's free wifi!!! Screw a coffee shop for wifi. They open at 11am
author: Ameer N.

description: This place is cool.  It has a great neighborhood feel, everyone is really nice (including the many regulars and their dogs).  It is VERY dive-y but comfortable and completley unpretentious.
author: Suzanne L.

description: Not bad at all. We went here on Tuesday not expecting much and didn't get much but it wasn't horrible. The bartenders were hella cool. Not much more I can say.
author: Chris L.

description:
yeah, i dig the 540. why? the music is excellent. 
i haven't been there on a busy night, so i can't complain about having suffered the mobs of hipsters and studded belt/leopard print wardrobes. 
it's great for catching up with friends. yes, i'm a granny, the music is a little too loud, but that's okay. it's music i love.
author: jennifer y.

description:
If this service had 6 stars I would use them for this bar, and only this bar. 
I think the 540 club rocks any type of ass. Even if you're ugly, you're bound to be sexy here. This is the bar where everyone knows your name. And if you have no name, they give one to you. They have a DJ that will instantly make out with you, too. 
Ok for some reason Ken, the bouncer doesn't believe in passports being a real valid form of identification. But I pity the fool who steps up to this 8 foot giant. Regardless, the owner is clever to cast such an ensemble of good hosts: Ken is awesome and a token company if you smoke cigarrettes, Richy Rich is FANtastic, even his gimpy friend Ricky, I adore Brooksley's ABS of DEATH, and all of the other members of this mightily high society of pink elephants (the mascot).
If you like belgian spicey beers, then you should try the devil's tail tap (chambli di chamblee) with an orange slice. They do have Hoegaarden on tap, along with $2 Pabst, and free darts.
author: Danielly A.

description: Sunday night trivia, large beer selection, strange art for sale.  The jukebox can download songs, so there's always something new available.
author: James D.

description: After a year in New York I still haven't found a bar as awesome as the fabulous 540. I met so many great people there...truly a group of genuine and totally awesome people. I spent more time here than I did sleeping at at work a couple of summers ago. I'm going to say it's because the bar is so awesome and not because I'm an alcoholic or anything....right....
author: Rhea B.

description:
excellent music! friendly service! prompt and inexpensive drinks!! happy hour until 7 & $2 pabst 

haha this place is outta control. heard about a trivia night im anxious to check out

free darts (yeaaaah boy)!
author: c e.

description: Solid, chill bar.  At first I thought, this bar would be perfect in the Mission and then I realized how cheap my drink was and how attitude-free the bar staff and clientele were, and decided 540 is just where it should be.
author: MakeUp M.

description: I mean, it's good, but it's not great.  Its location means I'm unlikely to get out that way often.  I was there for Catholic Schoolgirl Karaoke last Saturday.  It went well.  People were into it, the decorations were clever, and there was drunk karaoke (sung by what looked like, but certainly wasn't, Catholic schoolgirls).  But I also found it crowded and hard to walk around.  Beer selection was decent (I spent the night on Stella).
author: Nathan N.

description: You know I can't really explain why I like this place, but I do... I always end up here after a long night, just to have one last beer with the people I wanted to hang out with mano y mano...  But come to think of it what I love is the unpretentious feeling of this place, everyone is really nice never ran into a snob here, and people are genuinely interested in other people.   When you come here you feel like you walked into your friend's house party only no one is throwing up in the corner and the cop's never come asking for everyone's id's.  The beer selection if awesome, and they have dart's which always makes for some good laughs!
author: Cassie L.

description: A friendly, convenient dive. With dog. And sometimes bbq. I don't go here nearly often enough.
author: Fawn F.

description: Pretty chill place. Normally have good music. But only one set of darts with 4 dart boards? What's up with that?
author: Meghan L.

description: Who can beat $1 wells on Monday nights. Plus  they carry Hoegaarden on tap. Great little place with a diverse group of people. I've never seen this place empty even on  a mundane tuesday night.
author: Marie V.

description: Great Bar, if somewhat divey.  Punk Music, BBQ, Football and Darts.  Great way to pass a Sunday in the City.  Bar Staff and the Owner were all very cool and seemed to be on a mission to catch a buzz, and shortly after arriving, I was too.
author: Colin S.

description:
Lots of Sluts. Bartenders are nice enough. Good darts. Drink Specials. Smoking patio. LOVELY Bouncer.

Have a habit of kicking people out for no reason.

A definate locals bar with its own standing drama.
author: Stephanie C.

description: The 540 is one of the greatest places in the city to get straight to the point with your bar business in general.  Never a problem getting a drink and everyone who works there is amazing.  The best part of all is even though I am an avid fan of my Fernet Branca (an amaro staple in SF), at the 540, they really know how to chill a glorious shot of CHARTRUCE!!!  Go there!
author: Andrew S.

description:
this really is the only bar worth going to on clement st.the patrons are almost always in their 20's, but it never becomes oppressively hip. the flip side is that it never gets overly brah like most of the other clement bars. you could actually have a conversation with the other people there. i've heard a pretty eclectic mix of music spun here, and most of the music that gets played from the internet jukebox is pretty good too.  also, when it gets busy, you can always find some space. plus, $3.50 for an above average gin and tonic makes the place pretty hard to beat.

the one knock against the place is that it can get hot in there when they have a dj, because they can't open the doors to get some fresh air. i'm will ing to look past that due to the dearth of options in the area.
author: Russell B.

description:
Couldn't decide on 2 or 3 stars...

Total Dive bar in the middle of San Francisco's 2nd Chinatown... Bartenders are cool and interesting; however, the drinks are mediocre, and the place is FILTHY and smells really bad (even with the windows open-they always are).  The bathrooms are nasty-

However they do have a nice outside front patio and there is no yuppy attitude.   

So if you go there, get drunk and hopefully you'll forget about hygene-
author: C C.

description: Lots of good beer selection. Affordable prices. Cool people.
author: Pascal C.

description: Only my favorite dive in the hood.  Maybe it's because of the owner and the regulars...not to mention the bartenders.  I think this place will alwas have a place in ma heart.  Many good memories, and a few funky ones in the bathroom.  Ahhh, where did the Joy go?
author: Melo M.

description: if you like being treated like shit by the lowly asshole checking i.d.s at the door, then this is the place for you.  imagine that you are finishing the last of your beer at 1:50 and this coked up asshole comes and literally grabs the glass out of your hand and tells you to get lost.  that's what happens here.  it's as if he was intentionally trying to pick a fight with me.  luckily for him, my sensei has prohibited me from fighting outside the dojo.  I also witnessed the same angry dude yell at some couple for not hearing him mumble about taking their drinks inside.  too bad, because this used to be my favorite neighborhood bar (i have been going there for years.) but, if that's how they treat people, then from now on,  i'll be going elsewhere.  the saturday night door guy is not good for business. somebody needs to get that guy laid.
author: dick h.

description: Good strong drinks, fair prices, not too crowded, not too dead, not a meat market, yet usually a friendly, eclectic crowd that largely depends on who's spinning that night.  What's not to like?  Great place to bring a few friends, get trashed, and dance in the back to the DJ or awesome digital jukebox.  Oh, also dog-friendly, which is a rarity in the city.
author: Galen C.

description: I have a penchant for bars too cool to name themselves, but prefer to go by their street address instead  - and the 540 definitely qualifies. I love it for the beer. Ohhhhh the beer. Belgian, tasty and reasonably priced (except for the Chimay, but $6 for Chimay is good right?) The art never fails to be interesting, and at times also disturbing, but its never up for long so next time you go it will be replaced with something else. The jukebox never plays my songs, even mid-afternoon. I went in there one time dressed like Santa Claus and made all the girls sit on my lap and tell me what they wanted for Christmas..why does that make this a good bar? Because I didn't get kicked out for it. And trust me, in any other bar I would have. Santa drank way too much jager.  Oh, and $1 cocktails on Monday nights is never a bad idea. Unless its Tuesday morning, but thats what $2 Tuesdays are for. They were also smart enough to install coat hooks under the bar. I love not having to pick my jacket up off the bar floor after a night of good drinking.
author: Brenda K.

description: Dimly lit, great artwork, super bartenders, super deal drinks and Laguinitas Beer on tap....sold!
author: David B.

description: Great little unpretentious place with good beer on tap, good jukebox, super-nice bartenders and a nice local crowd.  I only wish they had a better wine by the glass.  I like to celebrate birthdays there because you are welcome to bring in cake and outside food and on weeknights there is always room to gather.  People who hang out here seem to be nice as well.  I guess water seeks its own level...
author: Priscilla C.

description: Damn! I LOVE this place. The bartenders are cute, the drinks are cheap, and the regulars are awesome! I cannot wait to go back!
author: Christine K.

description: i may be betraying my age here, but 540 sucked.  at 7pm, while waiting for a table burma superstar, i wandered in for a drink with a date.  the music was so impossibly and unnecessarily loud that 20 minutes later we left, deciding that waiting outside burma in the 48 degree windy evening was a more palatable option.  There were only like 8 people in the bar, all of whom were belligerently wasted and brawling.  on a tuesday.  at 7.
author: Matt S.

description: female bartender didn't know how to make a side car!?! the barback kept on climbing/standing on the bar, how clean is that?  jamie, you need to get your staff together.
author: Pickle R.

description: i get in trouble when i go there....but i keep going and now i only live 4 blocks away. not good. but good! i love this place.
author: Teri A.

description: Honestly, I used to never want to come to 540 on Monday nights. I don't know why, maybe I was being stubborn and not wanting to give into friends peer-pressure to go, but I will (hesitantly) admit, I am sad now when I see I am working Monday nights. Yes, the drinks aren't that good (what can you expect for $1 and cheap liquor), but there is a certain happy atmosphere that is present on Monday nights (again, what can you expect from $1 drinks and liquor). I guess I've changed my mind about this place, because you can bet to find me stumbling home at midnight on Mondays (ya right will I pay more than a $1 for a drink once their special ends).
author: Annie L.

description: a good bar to grab a drink and chill out.
author: Jamie K.

description: $1 Wells on Monday Night? $2 PBR Drafts all the time? Certainly cannot argue with the price. It seems like this place should be in the Mission, although the crowd is more post-graduate rather than straight-up hipster. The friendly bartenders also get a point. Too bad this place weren't bigger.
author: Jeremy J.

description: super fun on monday nights.. dollar drinks even though it takes like 6 or so to get drunk, get their earlier if you want to even get close to the bar. also hottie bartender.. makes it all worth while!
author: Kathleen P.

description: the 540 Club...dog friendly which my pup Chloe loves...Great people work and hang there...Super friendly bartenders, down to earth patrons  and great drinks...the way a neighborhood bar should be. =)
author: Michael M.

description: watched the super bowl here last year for 2006. was mighty fun, i do say! had myself a few bloody marys for breakfast with some free bbq lunch that they provided. some fun locals. i'll def hit this place again.
author: Victor B.

description: i have been to this bar before i had a date with a meerkat and it turned ugly. never trust a meerkat. every now and again i stop by on Sundays for good music and free bbq.
author: Goober U.

description:
it was fourth of july and i was feeling down and lonely.  my good side told me to call up a friend but my depressive side is a lot more influential and i figured i should just get wasted and celebrate uncle sam my own way (not watching the fireworks accompanied by 'god bless the usa', a standard 4th in the white suburb i grew up in.  does that song resonate with any americans who aren't white conservatives?).  i came upon the 540 club and it wasn't just the drinks that made me feel better.  it was like 'cheers' for a younger urban set.  the patrons were a generation older than me (mid 20's-early 30's) but they were incredibly warm and friendly- i felt like a little sister.  decent drink prices, funny bartenders.  instead of that goddamned song i mentioned earlier, they were playing some tom petty (yes, it was american girl). i'll come back and try some mixed drinks when i'm not broke.  thanks 540!  
540's got the only 'cute' bar logo i've ever seen.
author: Vanessa T.

description: love it. kind of our sister bar (i am one of the owners of "buckshot" down the street a little ways). not that i have time to go out anymore but it is nice when i do get a chance to escape for a little while to see the great crew over at the five four oh.
author: shanti s.

description: great bar with a solid jukebox, lots of regulars, and no elitist attitudes. they haven't quite found their way with the DJs, but that's my only complaint.
author: Roman H.

description: Consistently the best bar in The Richmond.  A great rotating selection of beer, a wide array of spirits, friendly patrons and an excellent staff behind the bar.
author: Jonah N.

description: great bar to hang out with friends.. has outdoor patio near the front entrance.. beer are cheap compare to other bars.. they do have theme events where you dress up... i would definitely go there next time when they have an event!!!! bartender are hot and friendly!!!
author: Lily T.

description: Good place to go to catch up with friends. My new favorite dive bar.  Just like how the Mission used to be, without the attitude problem.
author: Jessie H.

description: they have a battleship gameboard. awesome. the bartenders are cool and know good whiskey (^-^) i don't think i have ever not had fun here.
author: Nicole G.

description: i've only had the pleasure of drinking here once, but it was great. i would definately recommend coming here. dark, cheap options, good drinks, and DARTS.
author: megan t.

description: Interesting artwork on the walls give this place a cool vibe.   I went with a large group of friends on a Monday night, expecting that our crew would take over the place but the bar was surprisingly packed already.  I guess the $1 well drinks bring people out regardless of what day of the week it is.  They have a little area sectioned off for darts, but it's still a little cramped because they have a large and sort of awkwardly set up wooden desk thing that gets in the way.  Basically, good bar to go hang out with friends but a little too cramped sometimes.
author: A K.

description: 540 Pride till you die...the best bar that there every will be. the mission is full of asses...clop clop shoes...did i mention the mission sucks. outdoor patio..djs...Dollar Drinks on Monday Night. this bar is what a bar should be. good people. good music. and good staff. i can say its the best staff in the entire city.
author: richie f.

description: i used to go to this place religiously during my college career for monday night dollar drinks. .the only problem is you tend to leave this place way drunker than originally planned. on the brighter side, after one "just grab a few drinks monday night" i wont eat jack in the box anymore. thanks 540!  the crowd is definitely on the younger side, bartenders and bouncer are cool, good place to mingle. def a great weekday spot.
author: Eddie C.

description: I stopped going here since I moved away from the neighborhood.  First off, the place always smells like week-old puke.  Second, the bartenders are assholes.  The dollar drink nights are a complete rip off; I actually asked the bartender once why my drink was so weak, and he replied, "because it's dollar drink night."  Doesn't that just completely defeat the purpose?  But if you live in the Richmond and want to go to a place where everybody smoking outside can see you ride up on your fixed-gear track bike, this is the place to be.  It gets 2 (rather than 1) stars because of the jukebox of predictable yet listenable hipster fare.
author: Todd D.

description: Awesome place!  Great music!  Great service!  Great beer selection!  They even have Maredsous 10!  The thought of this place wants me to leave work and go get drunk!
author: Marko C.

description: $1 well drinks on mondays! so if you're a binge drinker on a budget (aka college student) this place is perfect!
author: N. M.
